loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr: Akossiwavi est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses trois enfants à charge. Agée de 34 ans, Akossiwavi est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des amuse-gueules et arachides en bouteilles au bord de la route afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour bien atteindre ses objectifs, Abravi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des amuse-gueules et de l’arachide en bouteilles afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Akossiwavi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin, where she is raising three children. Aged 34, Akossiwavi is a dynamic and courageous woman who sells snacks and peanuts in bottles on the roadside so that she can earn a good living.

So as to reach her objectives, Abravi buys her inventory four times a month at the market and wants this loan to order snacks and peanuts in bottles so as to finance her business and make a good income to cover her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 30 bottles of peanuts and 33 bottles of biscuits.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a mother of two daughters and six sons,living in a area of Lahore,Pakistan. Her son is a well mannered experienced furniture maker. So he has made plans to increase his business in the furniture shop. He wants to buy prepared furniture stock like sofa, bed, wooden chairs, etc. for reselling and some tools for furniture making purposes like coping saw, smoothing plane, combination square, bevel gauge, marking knife, card scraper, marking gauge, spoke shave, shoulder plane, block plane, chisel set etc.

He has built up very good relation with his customers.Therefore his mother Safia requested for loan, so that he would be able to buy more stock of wood for making furniture items and in this way he can meet his financial requirements as well. Therefore, Safia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; he hopes that the lenders would support him for his creativity.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making furniture by her son in his shop.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian lives with his wife and his 84 year old mother in Argokhi, Georgia. He produces honey and milk products to sell them at the local markets. His products are well known among his clients. Mirian has much experience in producing what is shown in the good and stable quality of his goods.

He wants to expand both the milk production and giving home for some new bee colonies, so he wants to use the loan for buying three more milk cows and some bee hives.

loans.use: to buy bee hives and milk cows.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.en:
Khoren is the chef in one of the restaurants in Gyumri town. He is highly trained, skilled professional cook who is proficient in all aspects of food preparation of particularly Armenian cuisine.
Khoren lives with his elderly retired mother, wife and 29 years old daughter. Khoren works day and night so the restaurant is able to provide high quality service and tasty dishes to the visitors.
Khoren now applied for this loan to ask some investment to his work as a chef. He plans to use the loan in purchasing tools needed in the restaurant kitchen and some materials for food preparation.

Khoren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Khoren will hope to receive lenders' support and improve his work.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed in the restaurant kitchen and some materials for food preparation

loans.name: Las Flores De Paquix Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Flores de Paquix” is located in the northwestern part of Guatemala, in the beautiful town of Chiantla, Huehuetenango. It is in a mountainous area about 167 miles from Guatemala City. The nine members of “Las Flores de Paquix” primarily have produce farms or do animal husbandry. They sell fruits and vegetables or chicken and sheep. They also have additional businesses selling new and used clothing.

Auri is 22 years old and the mother of three children. She sells fruits and vegetables from her house and then, three times a week she travels to market days in towns outside of Chiantla. Auri wants to increase her inventory, therefore, is asking for a new loan in order to buy a variety of fruits like watermelons, plantains, and pineapples. She is working to increase her income so that she can build a strong future filled with good opportunities for her three children. Auri wants to have enough income saved in order to have her children go to school, especially her first who will be able to enter school next year.

Auri and the other women of “Las Flores de Paquix” are happy to be clients of Friendship Bridge because they are able to take advantage of the organization’s “Microcredit Plus” program of credit and education. At each monthly meeting where the group works on loan payments, they also have a learning session with an important topic presented in their Maya language by the Friendship Bridge Facilitator. The Facilitator has visual aides like photos, diagrams and charts that make the topic easier to understand. The topics are all very useful for the women’s daily lives. They cover health, family life and business management.

The women are all extremely grateful to Kiva investors for making these programs possible. They grow stronger as they learn and become more self-empowered with greater self-esteem which helps their families and their communities. Thank you!!!

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits like watermelons, plantains, and pineapples for resale.

loans.name: Agaciro Sub Group A

texts.en:
Fausta is a group leader; aged 32 years.She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and who has 3 years. The group is called AGACIRO means “DIGNITY” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She owns a call service center and has been running in a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more air time for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more air time for sale.

loans.name: Tavae

texts.en:
Tavae is a 33-year-old mother with three children. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Tavae has requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi with her husband, son and parents. Mariam is unemployed. Her mother is an accountant and gets a small monthly income.

Mariam decided to purchase a vineyard. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit she will purchase a vineyard and the family will start producing wine to sell. They will have income from selling wine and will improve their living conditions. Mariam awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a vineyard and start producing wine to sell

loans.name: Nyaakom Group

texts.en:
This is a group called Ngaakom located in Teshie, a poor community. They are six in number and the group is represented by Gifty. Their ages range from 25- 45years. They are small scale traders and and single mothers. They basically trade in items like foodstuffs, smoked fish, provisions, sachet water, jerseys, underwear, ceramics and plastic wares. They have successfully completed their five loan cycles and believe this loan will help them expand their businesses.
Gifty is 45 years old and trades in jerseys, underwear and provisions. She normally gets her stock from the main market in Accra central. She sells her goods in Teshie and its environs and moves from house to house. She is a single mother with three children whose age range from 17 - 22 years. She is currently on her seventh loan cycle. She is requesting for this loan to purchase items like detergents, gari, sugar, underwear and jerseys to help her expand her business and improve the living standard of her family and also cater for their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase items like detergents, gari, sugar,underwear and jerseys to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Aged 43, Phalla is a villager living in a rural area of Pursat province. This married mother has four dependent children, one of whom is being educated in school, while another one is too young to attend school.

To better feed the family, she and her husband have been growing rice for years. Besides this, she is working as a teacher to earn additional income.

Because of a lack of water supplied to the farmland, the crop grows unhealthily and produces lower outputs. Phalla, who is the group leader, will spend her loan portion on purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fees to grow her crop well.

She wants to raise outputs so that she can be able to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop and earn more income to keep sending her child to school.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen  is 29 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
The borrower's name is Lelita, aged 47. She is from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Lelita is married to Abeliano, a small businessman with whom she has a college student.

Her husband's earnings are not enough to cover the college education of their child, which drove her to go into a direct-selling business. Education is a top priority in the budget of most Filipinos since it is a path to uplift their children's lives.

Lelita went into direct selling six months ago. She buys personal products such as beauty products, cosmetics and toiletries from popular direct-selling brands at a lower price than shown on the catalog, and sells them at a profit. Her customers benefit from direct selling because of the convenience and service it provides, including personal demonstration and explanation of products, home delivery, and satisfaction guarantees.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries and undergarments for her customers. Demand for her personal products has significantly increased as school time has started in the Philippines. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality.

She is hoping for your positive response as this will really help her increase her business, and thus help her daughter pursue a college degree.

Lelita aims to grow her business to allow them a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products for sale.

loans.name: Duterimbere Sub Group A

texts.en:
Jeannette is a group leader; aged 38 years.She is married with 2 children aged between 17 and 19 years. The group is called DUTERIMBERE means “LET US IMPROVE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Jeannette has a shop and has been running a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Lema

texts.en:
Lema is a 44 year old mother with 4 children.

She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. Lema requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tubers (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs.

She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubers (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Agée de 35 ans, Ayélé est une femme dynamique qui travaille pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour ce fait, Ayélé est une restauratrice de divers aliments dans un hangar à la devanture de son domicile à ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans ce lieu. Ayélé s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation une fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs, de riz et des pattes de bœufs afin d’atteindre son objectif et gagner son profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de son foyer.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a married woman who lives in Baguida and is raising five children. Aged 35, Ayélé is a dynamic woman who works to improve the lives of her children. To that end, Ayélé sells various cooked dishes in a shed in front of her house. Her clientele finds her cooking satisfying.

Ayélé buys the necessary ingredients for food preparation once a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order sacks of maize, of rice, and some cow's feet in order to meet her goals and earn her profit so as to keep her household moving forward.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize, one sack of rice, and two pairs of cow's feet.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict is a business lady who specializes with poultry rearing in Guruve District in Zimbabwe. She is 21 years old.  It is three years now since she started this business and she has achieved a lot of things through this business. She has become the bread winner of the family and she has been able also to pay school fees for her siblings.  With the repeat loan that she is requesting for, she intends to expand her poultry business and create employment for her community. Benedict inspires other young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop lives with his wife in Kapan town of Syuniq region. Their three children are married and lives separately with their families. 
Near the house where Mesrop and his wife live, Mesrop owns a garage which he uses as a workshop. Mesrop makes furniture and receives different orders from locals in the town. 
Mesrop applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials for covering new received orders and making furniture. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
Mesrop hopes to receive the loan and continue his beloved activity.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for covering new received orders and making furniture

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 33-year-old lady living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to save so that she can provide better living conditions for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.

Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy a rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Uzma Group

texts.en:
Uzma is 36-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of three children. Her husband, the only wage-earning person in the family, delivers luggage, grass, and water by using his rickshaw. He values the rickshaw more than any other possession, because it can make money for him to sustain their family life.

He needs capital for the maintenance of his rickshaw. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to pay for the maintenance. Therefore his wife Uzma,has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Uzma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband to repair a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Sobyouang Group

texts.en: Onh’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Onh and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Onh and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Onh’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Greda Traders Group

texts.en:
Greda Traders is a group in Teshie which has six members, five females and one male.The group is represented by Olivia standing in the photograph third from the left.Their ages range from 28 - 48years. All of them are traders who trade in items such as shampoo, wigs, disposable packs, fish, foodstuffs and charcoal.

Olivia is a hairdresser and has acquired a kiosk in Teshie. She also trades in shampoo, condition, wigs and weave-on and pomade to serve her customers better. She is married to David whose a mason and they have two children. Their ages are seven and three years and are in the primary school. She has over 5 years experience in her business.

She needs the loan to help purchase shampoo, condition, wigs, weave-on and pomade to expand her business and also support the husband in taking care of their two children and also improve their living standard.

loans.use: to help purchase shampoo, conditioner, wigs, weave-on and pomade to expand her business.

loans.name: Kasia

texts.en:
Kasia is a 37 year old mother with 2 children.

She runs a business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Kasia requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Vusalaga

texts.en:
Vusalaga is 23 years old from Bilasuvar and is an internally displaced person. He is single and is planning to get married. Currently he is working as phone repairer at the local bazaar. He has started repairing phones and electronic equipment 2 years ago. His monthly income is 180 AZN.
His elder brother is also helping him. Both of them take care of their family.

But Vusalaga’s income isn’t enough to meet the family needs. Currently he is planning to buy dozens of second hand phones, to repair them and sell in the market. He is hoping Kiva lenders will show him the required support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of second hand phones, to repair them and sell in the market.

loans.name: Reynsie Joy

texts.en:
General Santos City in South Cotabato is famous for its tuna aside from being known as the hometown of Manny Pacquiao. Fishing or catching tuna is the usual livelihood of many residents of the area. Reynsie Joy, 37 years old, is selling tuna in a public market in Calumpang, General Santos City for 16 years already. It’s the source of her family’s daily household needs and her children’s educational expenses.

But now the rainy season gives her difficulty to earn enough for her family. The price of tuna increases during this season and she can hardly afford it. This is the reason why Reynsie Joy is appealing for additional capital worth PhP 60,000 to augment her business. She can use this to buy high volume of tuna in order to keep her business running even during rainy days. Her profit from this will add to the income of her husband, Mat, who drives his own tricycle. Eventually her goal is to make her business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, complete her children’s education, and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Reynsie Joy is looking forward to seeing her kids finish their schooling and wear their professional clothes. She also gives importance to peaceful and harmonious living with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy high volume of tuna to sell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 47 years old and single with four children,all of whom arestill in school. Rosenda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, bread, spices, eggs, snacks foods, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, bread, spices, eggs, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca and her family are members of the vulnerable ethnic Egyptian Albanians and are very poor according to the national poverty level. Vjollca has been raising pigs to earn an income, yet they're not raised in a healthy way, unfortunately. These pigs eat mostly from the large garbage bins and other dirty things around. In any way, this is the sad reality of the case.

Vjollca needs this loan to build a toilet for her family.

loans.use: to improve sanitation and hygiene by building a toilet

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a new client in this institution; She is married and has children who attend school. She is a teacher at a Vocational secondary school in Rushasha. She was concerned with where to get money to complete her residential house and decided to apply for a loan in Ugafode of ugx5000000 so that she can buy iron sheets for roofing her house. Competition of the house will enable her household to have descent accommodation and it will also improve her family's standards of living. She is therefore very grateful for the financial support and also the flexible repayment plan that Ugafode rendered to her. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 28-years old married woman. Her financial condition is not so good. Her husband has been driving Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is being drive over local roads and for small distances. Its body made by polyester, which is not enough strong to bear jerks from the roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced, because it has rattled during driving.

Nagina requested a loan of PKR 45000 so that her husband can buy the rickshaw body, so that he could drive it smoothly. Nagina thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan to purchase the body for auto rickshaw by her husband.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is auto repairman from Getahovit village. He lives with his mother, wife and two little kids.
Aram rents a garage, where he provides different auto repair service works for locals in the village. He has applied for this loan to purchase a small truck which he needs for providing auto repair service.

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Aram to have a car and make his work effective.

loans.use: to pay for a small truck which he needs for providing auto repair service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more CDs, radios and cam,eras for sale.

loans.name: Chanrit

texts.en:
Chanrit, 32 years old, is living in a community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.50 a day.

Chanrit wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Agée de 74 ans, Lucie est une femme veuve qui vit à Baguida avec un enfant à charge. Lucie est une femme, qui malgré son âge se force pour travailler et avoir des revenus. De ce fait, Lucie s’approvisionne quatre fois  au marché des produits alimentaire qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Lucie nécessite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates, de piment des oignons afin de gagner plus de revenus et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Aged 74, Lucie is a widow who lives in Baguida and is responsible for one child. Lucie is a woman who, despite her age, tries hard to work and earn income. For this reason, she stocks up on foodstuffs four times a month at the market. She sells the food in front of her home.

Lucie needs this loan to order some baskets of tomatoes, hot peppers, and onions so as to earn more income and respond to the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of fresh tomatoes, five piles of onions, and three bags of hot peppers

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 23-year-old business lady who lives in Guruve District of Zimbabwe where she operates a poultry rearing business that she runs from her home. With the loan that she is requesting, she intends to expand her poultry rearing business from 50 birds every three weeks to rearing 150 birds every three weeks. She intends to purchase more chicks, vaccines and feeds using this loan amount.

She inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.

An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. Using the profits from her business so far, she has managed to construct a bigger fowl run and meeting the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks, vaccines and feeds.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 28 years old, an IDP from Bilasuvar. He is single and working as a merchant at the local bazaar. In his shop he is selling the variety of products like, but mostly small car accessories. He is taking care of his family. His income is very low and isn’t sufficient to cover family expenses.
Currently he is planning to grow his business and buy more stocks for the shop. Bayram wants to bring new car parts, especially headlights to sell in his shop. He requires funds to buy the stock. He hopes that Kiva lenders will enable him to grow his business.

loans.use: to enlarge his business and buy more stock of car accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Lubna Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a 35-years old married woman, lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sell it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Lubna requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this support site and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy recycled goods such as waste papers, iron, and plastic accessories for her husband's business

loans.name: Adjoavi Henriette

texts.fr: Adjovi est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans habitant à Baguida. Mère de six enfants, Adjovi est une marchande de riz mélangé du haricot et des objets en plastiques qui vend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Adjovi s’approvisionne du nécessaire au marché et  désire ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de plats en plastique et des unités de sceaux en plastique. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Adjovi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients afin d’aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a married woman aged 48 who lives in Baguida. The mother of six children, Adjovi sells rice mixed with beans as well as plastic objects in front of her home and in neighboring districts.

Adjovi stocks up on inventory at the market and wishes to have this loan to order several dozen plastic plates and some plastic buckets. With the profit she will make, Adjovi intends to improve her range of products and respond favorably to the needs of her clients so as to help her husband with family expenses and permit their children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 15 dozen plastic plates and five plastic buckets.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Srta. Laura trabaja y a la vez estudia para poder solventar sus estudios. Ella está estudiando la carrera de derecho, para poder ser una buena profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Una vez terminada la carrera pretende abrir un estudio jurídico y dedicarse plenamente a su profesión prevista.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, y también para poder pagar los derechos de sus exámenes.
texts.en:
Laura works and studies at the same time, in order to pay for her schooling. She is studying law to be a good professional who can help others. Once she has completed her degree, she plans to open a law office and work full time in her chosen profession.

Laura is a very hard working person who wants to get ahead. For that reason she puts forth her best effort. She seeks a loan to be able to pay her university fees, and also to be able to pay her exam fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees and exam fees.

loans.name: Dongbang Group

texts.en: Wang understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Wang knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Wang purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Wang is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhonny es una persona que lleva adelante una pequeña microempresa, una vidriera, a la vez que trabaja también está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería electromecánica.
Él es una persona con grandes deseos de superación, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder alcanzar su meta de ser un buen profesional de ayuda a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de su universidad, y también para poder pagar la matrícula de su carrera. Él es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, y se destaca por ser muy luchador.
texts.en:
Jhonny runs a small microenterprise, a glass store. While he works he is also studying electromechanical engineering. He is a person with big plans of success. For that reason he puts forth his best effort to achieve his goal of being a good professional who helps society.

He seeks this loan to be able to pay the monthly costs of his university, and also to be able to pay the registration fee of his major. He is very devoted to his studies, and stands out as very hardworking.

loans.use: to pay monthly university costs and a registration fee.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and single. She operates a business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Maria requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and containers, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and containers.

loans.name: Chomthong Group

texts.en: Xiengboua is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Xiengboua and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Xiengboua and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Xiengboua and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Xiengboua and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 52, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by trade. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art; he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, a buttering trowel, a pointing trowel, a hammer, a chisel, a jointer, and a level, which have became worn out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools.

Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

Kousar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mason's tools for her husband's construction service.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en:
Sai, 52 years old, is living in the community of Banteay, Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

To make a living and support her family, Sai manages and operates a farming business on small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of 4 USD a day.

Sai wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 41 years old, married and has three children. Her family lives at Amulung.

She is managing a store for her income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She also sell vegetables as an additional source of income. She is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

She hopes to continue improving her business to earn more funds for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 43 years old and married with three children.

Siony works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods, eggs and personal care products.

Siony has previously borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from weaving.

Siony aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods, eggs and personal care products.

loans.name: Mabina

texts.en:
Mabina is a married woman, 48 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mabina has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Mabina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell on her stall.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Abla  s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des produits d’alimentations générales.  Pour s’approvisionner, Abla se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de tomates en boîtes et des bidons d’huile, Abla nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Abla  va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abla, age 45, is married with two dependent children. She lives in Baguida. She works hard to make a living by selling general grocery items. She stocks up 4 times per month at the market.

Abla is seeking this loan to buy boxes of canned tomatoes and jugs of oil.

She plans to use her profits to help her husband with the household's day-to-day expenses and to support her children's academic education.

loans.use: to buy 7 boxes of canned tomatoes and 2 jugs of oil.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise stitching by machine and selling embroidered dresses in his town. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work for daily wages. He also brings some material home for Nagina, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession and he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. For this purpose he requires some capital to buy the desired inventory, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Nagina made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is a Samoan citizen. She is a 49-year-old mother.

She runs a business of selling fish at the market to earn a living. She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Maselina requested a loan to buy a fishing net, fishing gear, torch, ice bag, container, and a new canoe to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing gear, torch, ice bag, container and new canoe.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, is married and supports five children. He has been practicing tea farming for the last 10 years, earning an income of 12,000 KES per month.

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and improve family standards.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Masela

texts.en:
Masela is a 53-year-old mother of seven children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living.

Masela requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2013 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Jamillo

texts.ru: Жамилло 57 летняя женщина из маленького района под названием Шахритус. Шахритус самое теплое место во всей Республики. Жамилло здесь живет вместе с мужем-таксистом и 5 детьми. Он дома занимается животноводством как 60% населения. Жамилло 15 лет работает в этой сфере деятельности. Жамилло решила купить несколько голов телят и бычков. Она надеется совершить покупку с помощью заемных средств. Она надеется, что она получит средства и осуществить свой план. Вы можете сейчас поддержать Жамилло!
texts.en: Jamillo is a 57-year-old woman from the small region called Shahrituz, which is the warmest place in the whole country. She lives there with her husband, a taxi driver, and their five children. Like 60 percent of the population, she works at home in animal husbandry, an occupation she has had for 15 years. She has decided to buy a few head of calves and steers. She hopes to make the purchase with the help of this loan money. She hopes that she will receive the amount and be able to carry out her plans. You can support her now!

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 28-year-old mother of five children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living.

Malia requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan to assist her run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2013 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур, 52 года, замужем, мать 3 дочерей. У Айнур средне-специальное образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень и клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Айнур в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Айнур обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainur is 52 and married with three daughters. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in agriculture for many years. She has two cows and two horses on her farm as well as 2 hectares of land where she grows barley and clover both for her own use and for sale. Her husband and children happily help her with the business. She also has everything necessary to care for livestock.

Ainur has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a cow to increase sales of organic milk. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and wants to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase sales of organic milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and seeds for planting in order to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian es estudiante, pretende ser un gran profesional, y busca su desarrollo como docente universitario, es ingeniero en ecología humana y pretende enriquecer sus conocimientos siguiendo la carrera de didáctica universitaria. Comenta que le gustaría poder ayudar a las demás personas que al igual que él quiera estudiar y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de su carrera, y también su matrícula.
texts.en:
Christian is a student who wants to become a great professional. He is looking for his development as a university professor. He is an engineer of Human Ecology and he wants to increase his knowledge to pursue his studies in university teaching. He comments that he would like to be able to help other people as well as wanting to study and be someone in life.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the monthly fees for his courses and also his registration.

loans.use: to pay for registration and monthly university fees.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas, aged 22, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married, hard-working man charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children aged 3 to 7 years, both of whom attend school.

Nicholas operates a hardware shop mainly selling bars, iron sheets and cement, among other items. In order to supplement his income, he ventured into farming cassava and beans. He hopes to expand and educate his children.

Nicholas will use the loan to buy more iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.use: to buy more iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drums and mats to sell.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 22 years old and single. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Miriama requested a loan to buy vegetable seed, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seed, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizer and herbicide for his crops to enhance quality and improve yields

loans.name: Prosperity- Kalerwe Bypass Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 33-year-old father of two children. He rents a two-roomed house on the outskirts of the city. He owns a bodaboda (passenger motorcycle), which he rides on a daily basis. This business fetches him some money to facilitate him to look after his family and also to pay school fees for his two children, who go to school.

Emmanuel is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDL). He is applying for a loan of UGX 500,000. The purpose of the loan is to top up, so as to purchase another bodaboda for his transport business.

Given the loan, his income and profits will increase greatly. He also has a dream of expanding his bodaboda business and also venturing into other businesses.

Emmanuel and the other group members appreciate the support given to them.

The seventh person (lady 2nd left) is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To boost his income by buying another motorcycle to ferry people

loans.name: Donga

texts.fr: Mariée, Donga est femme de 55 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge à Baguida. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Donga prépare et vend de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchakpalo » et des beignets à son domicile et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Donga réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce et désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil, des bols du haricot et des bidons d’huile afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi donc leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Donga, age 55, is married with four dependent children. She lives in Baguida. She makes a living by making a local alcoholic beverage called Tchakpalo as well as beignets that she sells from her home. She stocks up on ingredients three times per month at the market.

Since this activity is very profitable, Donga is seeking a loan to order bags of millet, some beans, and some oil to maximize her profits and help her husband to provide for their children and support their studies.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of millet, 23 bowlfuls of beans, and 2 jugs of oil.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina who is in her late 30s is married with four children who are grown up. She has been running a beauty salon for ten years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Amina’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to renovate her salon by painting the shop, bought another dryer and salon products. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit for loan repayment, saved money in her bank account, reinvested in the business and covered her household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date salon equipment to meet her customers’ requirements. She dreams of building her own house and of buying another plot.

Amina will make sure she pays her loans within the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy up dated salon  products and meet her customer's requirement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase certified fertilizer and herbicide for his young trees to enhance their quality.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is a clever woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is married and has six children. She is a teacher of beginner classes. She has 23 year of work experience in the sphere of education. She likes her specialty and is always ready to help others to get an education. She and her husband are raising their six well behaved children together.

She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a loan to pay for her son and daughter’s tuition fees for their studies. She hopes for Kiva lender’s kindness and support. The loan will help her to educate two of her children.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s and son’s education fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, snacks foods, milk, coffee, spices and other items. Melanie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, snack foods, milk, coffee, spices and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 51-year-old mother with nine children. She owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. Amelia requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a gas stove to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a gas stove

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona luchadora que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Quiere ser una profesional independiente, es por ello que pone todo lo mejor de sí. Comenta que le gustaría poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Marcia is from the city of San Ignacio. She is pursuing a career in Accounting. She is a fighter who strives to be able to be someone in life. She wants to be an independent professional; it is why she puts in all her best. She says she would like to be able to help other people through her knowledge. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her career fees, and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: El Bien Comun Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Bien Común¨, está coordinado por el señor José de 67 años, a su mayoría de edad ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y trabajador. Con su pareja y 2 hijos, tiene diversificados tipos de actividad económica como la venta de tortillas, leche agria, cuajada y gaseosa. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, con el dinero que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior como analista de presupuesto. Ahora requiere del crédito para la compra de maíz, leña, vasos, bolsas, leche y gaseosa. Teniendo así ingresos económicos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. 
Las demás integrantes son Juanita, de 40 años, quien tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y con el crédito abastecerá de más productos para la venta. Y Idalia de 45 años dedicada a la venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
The solidarity group ¨Bien Común¨ [Common Good] is coordinated by José who is 67 years old. Over the years he has proven to be a responsible and hard-working person. With his life partner and their two children he has a number of different money-making activities such as selling tortillas, buttermilk, curds, and soda pop. He has had this business for four years and he started it from the money he earned as a budget analyst.

He now needs a loan so he can buy corn, wood, glasses, bags, milk and soda. Earning income from selling these things allows him help his family get ahead.

The other members of the group are Juanita and Idalia. Juanita is 40 years old and runs a small grocery store out of her house. She will use the loan to stock up with more products to sell. Idalia is 45 years old and sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, glasses, bags, milk and soda pop.

loans.name: Intwali Sub Group A

texts.en:
Sylivia is a group leader; aged 29 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 4 years. The group is called INTWARI means “HEROS” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Sylvia has a shop and has been running a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with her parents. She is capable, responsible and genuine person. She is a student and likes to study at university. She wishes to be a business lady and serve people and is willing to work for social change.

She studies at the Entrepreneur and Service Institute. She gets excellent marks and the teachers are satisfied with her activeness. She needs to pay her higher education costs. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to pay her education fees. Loans will help her to continue her studies and get a higher degree of knowledge.

loans.use: help her to continue her studies and get a higher degree of knowledge.

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en:
Tuamasaga is a Samoan citizen. She is 55 years old with eight children. Tuamasaga is a hardworking mother. She runs a business of sewing clothes and selling elei prints at the market, in her village, and in public with the help of her children.

She was thinking of expanding her business, but in order to do this, Tuamasaga requested for a bigger amount of loan to buy another sewing machine, rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, printing machine, to help her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is a 32 year old mother with 3 children. She runs a business of cooking rice and curry and sell them in her community to earn a living. Katerina requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, container, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to build a small restaurant in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, containers,.

loans.name: Eddie José

texts.es: Eddie,  de 40 años, casado y con un hijo de 14 años a su responsabilidad, cursando actualmente la secundaria. Es un hombre trabajador y esta con ADIM por 3era vez para solicitar crédito para el crecimiento y estabilidad de su negocio. El es dueño de un taller de zapatería, con la ayuda de su esposa lograron construir esta microempresa. Con los crédito que obtuvo anteriormente logro ampliar y diversificar su producción. Ahora requiere del crédito para comprar materia prima necesaria como suelas, forros, azulón, fibra, telas pega blanca y amarilla.
texts.en:
Eddie is 40 years old, married, with one 14 year old child he cares for, who is currently in middle school. He is a hardworking man who is with ADIM for the third time to seek a loan for the growth and stability of his business.

He is the owner of a shoe repair store. With the help of his wife he was able to build this microenterprise. With the previous loan he received, he was able to increase and diversify his production. Now needs a loan to buy necessary raw materials such as soles, fibers, fabrics, and white and yellow glue.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials such as soles, linings, fiber, fabrics, and white and yellow glue.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha  is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Intwali Sub Group B

texts.en:
Pacifique is a group leader; aged 32 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6 years. The group is called INTWARI means “the great” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Pacifique has a shop and has been running a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay medical insurance and renovate to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet runs a flourishing poultry business in her community in Guruve District in Zimbabwe. She is a role model to the other young women in her community when it comes to entreneurship.

Using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Juliet intends to purchase more broiler chicks to rear and sell. She also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide who takes secondary school students through the well-being program at a school that is in her community.

Using the proceeds from her business, she managed to rewrite the ordinary level subjects that she had not passed. She is now assisting her family in meeting their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and expand the business.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a farmer from Blindesti village, Ungheni region in Moldova. His wife, Valentina, helps him to manage this farm. They have three children who all are married and have their own households in Blindesti. Andrei raises corn, sunflowers and alfalfa on 1.5 hectares of land.

He has been working his land manually for 20 years. Andrei, also raises different animals: a horse, three pigs, two cows, 50 chicken and 30 rabbits.

Andrei will use this loan to buy a mini tractor to work his land.

As a result, the productivity of his farm will increase and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a mini tractor for agricultural work.

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en: Naotala is a Samoan mother, 52 years old with seven children. She runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living with the help of her husband. Naotala requested a loan to pay for a freezer, license registration for alcoholic beverages, sugar, salt, chicken, sausage, rice, etc, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer, license registration for alcoholic beverages, sugar, salt, chicken, sausage, rice, etc,

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
HAMISI, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children; one is still in school and the other one is still young. He has been selling clothes for eight years now. He works from 8pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be HAMISI's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his clothing stock and has paid back all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in the business, and pay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes for resale. He dreams of owning a very big clothing shop.

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group, MALUMBO, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 48 years old, is married and supports ten children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last ten years, earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

David has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and more varieties of suckers for a high quality of bananas. He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children. David's hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and more varieties of suckers for a high quality of bananas.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 42, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a father of three children. To make a living, he is employed as a construction worker and earns, on average (USD) $8 a day .He has been in this career for more than 10 years. He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, Phalla can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a 23-year-old business lady who lives in Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She operates a poultry rearing business that she runs from her home. With the loan that she is requesting, she intends to expand her poultry rearing business from 100 birds every three weeks to 200 birds every three weeks. She intends to purchase more chicks, vaccines and feeds using this loan.

She inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. Using the profits from her business so far, she has managed to construct a bigger fowl run and meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Sub Group B

texts.en: Twitezimbere is a group led by Jeannette, who is 36 years old. The group name means “Develop each other” in English. Jeannette is married and has four children aged between 5 and 12 years old. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past six years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more fruits, potatoes and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, potatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita lives in Liquisa. Everyday her life is busy with her business because she is earning a good income from it. She started to plant vegetables in 2014 with her own working capital of $300. Bendita brings the harvested vegetables to the market to sell.

Bendita is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. She is taking the loan to buy more manure, other vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds and other items.

loans.use: to buy manure, other  vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds  and other items.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice is a business lady who specializes in raising poultry in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She is 21 years old.  She started this business two years ago and she has achieved a lot of things through this business. She has become the breadwinner of the family and she has been able to improve her standard of living.  With the loan, she intends to expand her poultry business and create employment for her community. Rejoice inspires other young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Henriette Sylvie

texts.en:
Henriette is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up in a small town in central Rwanda with her mother, who is a nurse. Due to her strong academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because she wants to learn the skills necessary to become a successful businessperson.

Henriette plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She hopes to work on many projects inside and outside the classroom while at Kepler to learn what most interests her for her career after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a first-year student at Kepler. He was raised by his mother and grandmother under difficult family circumstances. Due to his tremendous work ethic and academic ability, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He is the first in his family to attend university.

Silas plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Silas hopes to start his own real estate business that focuses on low income housing for the underprivileged. He was inspired to do this after seeing the conditions that individuals like his grandmother endured as they helped him through life.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Jean Jacques

texts.en:
Jean is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a small town near Congo with his mother and five siblings. Due to his impressive academic record and test scores, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to have a fulfilling career. He is the first in his family to attend university. 

Jean plans to study Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to work in the energy industry, perhaps helping to grow Rwanda's emerging solar power market. Jean hopes to use his earnings from work to support his younger brothers and sisters through school.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in Rwanda's capital of Kigali with his mother who worked at a supermarket. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. The first in his family to attend university, Roger chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and reputation for job placement. 

Roger plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to become an entrepreneur. At Kepler, he plans to develop his technology, leadership, and problem solving skills.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.es: Brunilda, de 35 años de edad, acompañada y con 3 hijos de edades 17, 10 y 9 años, quienes cursan la primaria y secundaria respectivamente. Dueña de una microempresa, procesadora de bebidas como bolis, gelatina y fresquitos. Dedicada a esta actividad económica desde hace 2 años, quien la construyo con los ahorros de su trabajo anterior en una zona franca.  Por primera vez esta con ADIM, solicitando crédito con el fin de poder engrandecer su negocio. Con el dinero invertirá en la compra de materiales de insumo como saborizantes, acidulantes y plásticos, y otra parte del crédito para terminar de construir una parte de su pequeña fábrica, para la elaboración de  productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Brunilda, age 35, is in a relationship and has three children ages 9, 10, and 17.  Her children are in elementary and secondary school, respectively.  

She is the owner of a small business which makes refreshments such as freezer pops, gelatin snacks, and flavored drinks.  She has been in this line of work for two years, building it up with savings from her previous job in a free trade zone.  

She is with ADIM for the first time, asking for a loan with the goal of being able to expand her business.  With this money, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies such as flavorings, acidifiers, and plastic items.  With another part of the loan she will finish construction on part of her small factory for the manufacture of high-quality products.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flavorings, acidifiers, and plastic items, as well as to finish construction on her small factory.

loans.name: Los Laras Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Los Lara”, conformados por dos mujeres y un varón. Demostrando ser personas responsables y muy laboriosas, para poder sacar adelante a sus familiares con ayuda económicas. Están por 3era vez solicitando crédito para aumentar sus inventarios de sus negocios.

María, de 21 años, acompañada y responsable de un hijo de 3 años. Se dedica a la artesanía en Bambú, de donde principalmente fabrica canastos. Teniendo este negocio desde hace 10 años con la ayuda de su cónyuge, desea del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bambú, y para el transporte de su mercadería.  Con este crédito está segura que podrá aumentar su negocio y proporcionarles a otras personas empleo. Los demás miembros son María Esther, de 21 años dedicada a la venta de confites de manera ambulante desde hace 7 años, y Joel de 26 años dedicada a la venta de pan tostados, suaves y barras de manera ambulante desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The “Los Lara” group is made up of two women and one man. They have shown themselves to be responsible and very industrious in being able to get their families ahead with their economic support. This is the third loan they are requesting to increase the inventories of their businesses.

María is 21 years old, in a relationship and is responsible for a three year old son. She works in bamboo handicrafts primarily making baskets. She has had this business for 10 years with the help of her spouse. She wants this loan to invest in the purchase of bamboo and in transporting her merchandise. With this loan she is sure she can expand her business and provide other people with people with employment.

The other members of the group are María Esther who is 21 and has sold candies itinerantly for 7 years and Joel who is 26 years old and has worked selling bread, toast and baguettes itinerantly for 5 years.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bamboo and in transporting her merchandise.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 45 years old, married and has two children. She is managing a store for profit. Her spouse is a driver and farmer too. She wanted to improve her sales by selling more grocery items that will give her more profits. So, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, soap and shampoo to sell. She hopes to keep selling good products and services and become successful in the retail business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers  and seeds for planting in order to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Joao

texts.en:
Joao built his house a few years ago. Now he has plans to repair his house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for his house to be rehabilitated.

So, he is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete his materials. He is taking this loan because he wants to buy more materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials to use.

He is very happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin to him, because with this loan he can be repair his house.

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials to use to repair his house.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
From Polomolok, South Cotabato, this is Marilou, 41 years old, who is busy with her sari-sari or variety store and a scrap business. She sells various commodities for everyday consumption by the people in her community. From time to time, she grills barbecue meat in front of her store to augment her income. She also buys scrap metals, bottles, plastics, papers and boards from scavengers. Marilou organizes it before selling to a junk shop. She contemplates on possible ways to enhance her business. She hopes that in due time, her variety store will grow into a grocery that will also sell rice and school supplies. For now, she focuses on her scrap business because it helps many individual scavengers and it contributes a lot to the recycling process in their town. Marilou applied for a PHP 10,000 loan partly to buy scrap and partly to procure more supplies for her store. Additional income that will be derived from this loan will help cover daily expenses and the tuition fees of her four children who are studying in high school and elementary school. She and her husband Rey, a government employee, are working hard to achieve their dream of their children completing their education.

Marilou is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell and recycle and supplies for her store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a divorced mother of 2 children, who was selling live chickens at her local market. The revenue from the business was however never enough to pay fees and feed the children as well. She therefore decided to pursue other opportunities in the hope of improving her finances.
With the help of a self-help group, she has managed to secure a small piece of land where she can practice horticulture. She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy organic vegetable seeds as well as to install an irrigation system. She plans to supply the vegetables to small shops as well as to the many vendors around her area.

"I know the women because we sold in the same market. I will supply them" says Christina.
