She hopes to grow the business and build a house for her family in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy organic vegetable seeds and install an irrigation system.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in Guruve District of Zimbabwe, where she operates a poultry rearing business that she runs from her home. She is requesting a loan because she intends to expand her business from rearing 200 birds every two weeks to 200 birds every week. Grace has this intention because she now sells her broilers to the nearby boarding school whose demand for chickens is very high.

Grace inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. An increase in income will enable Grace to support herself and improve her family’s well-being. Using the profits from her business so far, she has managed to pay school fees for siblings, buy her parents a cow and become the bread winner for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks to rear and sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es de la ciudad de Itá  vive sus padres y hermanas, comenta que trabaja como Masajista Terapéutica hace más de 8 años. A la par que trabaja está estudiando para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Es una persona muy sacrificada que no tiene miedo a luchar para poder salir adelante.
Sandra pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como  lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Sandra is from the city of Ita. She lives with her parents and sisters. She comments that she has worked as a massage therapist for more than 8 years. At the same time, she is also going to college to have more chances in life. She is a very demanding person who is not afraid to struggle to move forward. Sandra is requesting a loan to pay for her college tuition fees, and in this way to continue with her studies as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, who is in his mid-thirties, is married with one child who is still in school. He has been a tailor for fifteen years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be William's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy another sewing machine and sewing products and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy good materials for making nice dresses and men's suits, and for sewing products. He dreams of becoming an international tailor.

William will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy good materials for making nice dresses and men's suits, and for sewing products.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita, 44 years old, is married and has two children. Perlita raises hogs to sell and her spouse is a tricycle driver offering transport services. Perlita's daughter is a college student in need of additional sustenance but their income is not sufficient to sustain all their needs. Perlita is now asking for an educational loan of PHP 6,000 to pay her child's tuition fees. She promises to repay her loan in full. Perlita hopes her daughter will become successful in her chosen career someday.

loans.use: to pay her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Emelynda

texts.en: Emelynda is 53 years old and married with three children. One of her children is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Emelynda is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has been farming rice for 18 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Emelynda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 59 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lucena is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucena has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling feeds and rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 44 years old and has four children. Maribel is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maribel has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with four children. She is 42 years old, and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merlyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married to an electrician. She has no children of her own but is the step-mother to a nine-year old girl. Her husband's business is not making enough money to sustain the family. Anna therefore has been doing domestic work to supplement her husband's income. This, however, is also proving difficult. She is 53 and is not able to do chores as she used to. Not one to give up, she joined a self-help group that has been contributing toward the betterment of its members and the community at large.

Through this group she has managed to secure a small parcel of land and has already started farming. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticide as well as to install irrigation pipes to sufficiently provide water for her crops.

Anna hopes this loan will help her start a stable business and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticide and to install irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Dulmi

texts.es:
Dulmi es una persona que esta luchando para poder ser una buena profesional, lucha para poder dar a su familia, en especial a su hijo una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante, y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus clases de la universidad.
Ella hoy pide de vuelta este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Dulmi is a person who is struggling to be a good professional. She works hard to give her family, specially her son, a decent life without needs. She is a very selfless woman who wants to prosper. She comments that she used her previous loan to pay for her college courses. Today, she is requesting this loan again to pay for her college tuition fees, and in this way to continue with her studies as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of tomatoes and crates of soda to satisfy her clients, who have increased in the market, and to meet the family demands.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 62 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anastacia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat and seasonings for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anastacia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat and seasonings for her business.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita is 51 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years. Bernardita is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell. In the future, Bernardita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans habitant à Baguida. Adjo est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Adjo s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois ; ce qui lui permettra d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Adjo, age 43, is married with three children. She lives in Baguida. Adjo is a reseller of charcoal who works hard to earn a living.

Adjo stocks up four times per month at the market. She is seeking this loan to buy sacks of charcoal, which would help to boost her sales. She wants to help support her family's expenses and get her children ready to resume school.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que su inspiración primeramente es su familia. Quiere formarse como una buena profesional y de ese modo poder cubrir todas sus necesidades.
Su familia su apoyo fundamental en todos los sentidos. Anhela poder encontrar un trabajo que le permita desenvolverse y demostrar sus capacidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is studying business administration. She says that her primary inspiration is her family, who is her fundamental source of support in every sense. She wants to become a professional so that she can cover all of her needs. She is eager to be able to find work that will allow her to develop and prove her abilities.

Maria is asking for this loan so that she can pay her tuition fees and continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married woman with nine children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has four children who are currently in school. Maria has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 2 years. She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 37 years old and the mother of a small child. She is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming and cassava growing have been the sources of her family’s income for 19 years.

Recently, her crop has not grown well and it earns her a very low income, which causes her to not have enough working capital to do farming for this season.

Now, she is leading a group of three members to apply for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund Cambodia, and she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to grow a healthy crop. She hopes this loan will help to increase her income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow a healthy crop to increase her income so as to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and seeds for planting in order to get better harvest.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is married and has three children. Her parents were farmers and she was taught how to breed and keep livestock from her childhood. She and her husband tried to work hard and ensure a good future for their children.

She has a dream to educate her son at higher institutes. He graduated high school with excellence and passed exams at for the university. She wants to have a chance to educate her son at university and asked a loan from IMON to pay his tuition fee. Loan from Kiva will help her to educate her son at university.

loans.use: to educate her son at university.

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Pulimtiva, who is in her mid 30s is a divorcee with four children who are still in school. She has been selling fish for three years now. She works from 08am to 02pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the fish stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to pay loan, saved some in her bank account and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on fish stock, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of building her own house.

Pulimtiva will share this loan with her loan group Mnuka which has two members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on fish stock, also to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and seeds for planting in order to get better harvest.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 61 years old and has six children. Aquilina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Aquilina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Aquilina requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Aquilina has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Aquilina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Barthazar

texts.en: Barthazar is 47 years old. He is married with four children aged 9-11. He is a motorcyclist and has been doing business for the past nine years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy another motorcycle for transportation. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Monica has been in this business for 9 years. Monica earns more income from raising pigs.

Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and farming coconut and banana.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers via her fruit vending business.

Ma. Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Dolores has been in this business for four years. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rugima

texts.en:
Rugima is 38 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school.

Rugima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rugima requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rugima has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rugima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds & supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man aged 35 with 5 children 3 attending school. He lives in a rural area with the family and deals in cattle keeping as well as trading and also doing agriculture as a side business. He has been in business since 1990 and works all the 7 days of the week and 14 hours per day and started the business to improve on the family income and to get school fees for the children.

He acquired the loan to purchase more cows for the business and his clients are traders from the city. His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows in his home village and the challenge he faces is poor weather condition where the pasture dries up and the cows are emaciated affecting their output therefore slowing down his profit.

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates the friendly repayment terms of UGFODE of paying quarterly which gives him time to breed the cows to when they have fattened enough to bring more income.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle is 43 years old with 4 children ages 21, 12, 10 and 7 years old.
Her husband is helping her operate their computer shop rental business which is open from 7 am to 11 pm. Their computer shop business is their only source of income which helps provide for their everyday needs and education of their children.

Jingle most challenges is having her computers parts such as keyboards and mouses malfunctioning or broken and computers programs are corrupted due to viruses thus disabling their use for business.

Jingle is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy mouses, keyboards and pay for the maintenance of the computers to maximize their operations and service.

The loan will enable her to optimize the services of her computers to generate higher income to provide for their needs.

Jingle wanted to add a grocery store (sari-sari store) and school supplies just beside her computer shop in the future as additional income since the customers are also asking for items and food while they rent computers and search the net.

Jingle is working hard not just to support their everyday expenses but also to save for her children education since its her dream to see her children finish their school.

loans.use: to buy mouses, keyboards and pay for the maintenance of the computers to maximize their operation and service.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 58 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother of 3 and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren is ages 48 years and a mother of four children and two of whom are depending on her. She is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming and cassava growing are the sources of her family’s income for thirty years. Recently, her crop has not grown well and it earns her a very low income, which causes her to having not enough working capital to do farming for this season.
Now, she is leading a group of three members to apply for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund and she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop healthily and protect it from being threatened by insects. She hopes this loan will help to increase her income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop healthily and protect it from being threatened by insects

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Vasuki And Group

texts.en:
Vasuki is 28 years old and lives in Tiruchirappalli . She has a family size of 4.

Vasuki is the leader of a group of 4 women. She finds it hard to manage her household expenses with her current family income. She realizes the need to add another source of income to fund her children's education. Thus she underwent training in saree stone designing and is now ready to start a business of her own. The only thing stopping her is a lack of funds.

Vasuki needs a loan to kick start her business. She is joined by 4 women who come from similar backgrounds and also seek a loan to start their respective businesses. Your loan will help these women provide for their family and secure the future for their children.

loans.use: to start her saree stone designing business

loans.name: Sylinirina Joséphine

texts.fr:
Joséphine est une jeune femme dynamique de 23 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille en tant que maçon. Ils ont ensemble un petit garçon de 6 ans et qui est en classe CP2.
Puisque le salaire du mari ne suffit pas à couvrir toutes les dépenses familiales, donc Joséphine a décidé en 2014 d'exercer une activité de vente des chaussettes pour augmenter le revenu familial et améliorer la condition de vie de la famille. Et pour pouvoir développer et étendre cette activité, renforcer le fonds de roulement, elle demande un crédit à travers CEFOR. Actuellement, la construction d'une petite maison est en cours, son objectif est de la finir le plutôt possible, elle maintient à épargner autant que possible.
texts.en:
Joséphine is a dynamic young woman of 23. She is married and her husband works as a mason. The two of them have a little boy of six years old who is in first grade.

Since the salary of her husband is not enough to cover all the family's expenses, Joséphine decided in 2014 to open a stall selling socks to add to their income and improve living conditions for the family.

In order to develop and expand this activity, and grow her working capital, she is asking for a loan through CEFOR. Presently, the family is building a little house. Joséphine's goal is to finish it as soon as possible. so she continues to save as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy socks and stockings for resale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a mother of 43 years old with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village. Sandra requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds for cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, hand gloves, to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, hand gloves,.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-years-old single young man from Tubas, a small village near Jenin city. His father works as a farmer where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies accounting. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the final semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay his university fees for the final semester.

loans.name: Los Palacios Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Los Palacios¨, lo conformas personas que el día a día trabaja duro para así poder salir adelante y poder salir adelante con mejores ingresos económicos.  Quien coordina el grupo es Yacela, de 27 años, casada y con dos hijos. Se dedica a la venta de especies desde hace 10 años. Ahora con el dinero solicitado comprara por mayor para después venderlo al detalle como la manzanilla, canela, algodón, chote, salsa inglesa, mostaza. 
Los demás integrantes son, Yerald, 24 años e Irma, 33 años se dedican a la venta de especies en diferentes partes de la ciudad. Y Heyling de 19 años quien prepara y vende comida fritanguera en su domicilio desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The “Los Palacios” group is made up of people who work hard day to day in order to be able to move ahead with better income. Yacela is the one who coordinates the group. She is 27 years old and is married with two children. She has sold spices for 10 years. Now with the money requested she will buy wholesale in order to then sell retail. She will buy items such as chamomile, cinnamon, cotton, flower buds, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard.

The other members are Yerald, 24 years old, and Irma, 33 years old. They sell spices in different parts of the city. Also Heyling, 19 years old, who has made and sold fried food in his home for 2 years.

loans.use: buy chamomile, cinnamon, cotton, flower buds, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

Myrna is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish stall for her fish vending business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, canned goods, coffee, etc.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon Gari Daji Village. Alhaji  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Alhaji  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Alhaji  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 47 bags of maize this year, Alhaji  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a man of about 35 years living with his wife and two children, both of whom are going to school.

Edward is involved in cattle fattening and trade, a project that he has reaped a lot of benefits from, such as a steady source income. According to Edwards, he has been in the above activity for his entire life. Alongside cattle fattening and trade, Edward is also involved in farming, which is a contributing factor to his sources of income.

According to Edwards, through the above projects he has been able to educate his children plus also providing for his family other essential necessities.

Edward acquired this loan to boost his cattle fattening business and farming. He says he is going to buy cows and manure for his farm and gardens respectively.

Edward says his customers are basically cattle traders from his home area. According to him, his biggest challenge is cattle diseases such as foot and mouth disease, plus also droughts that dry up water for drinking.

Edward is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. He appreciates work done by Ugafode Microfinance for the work it does.

loans.use: improve his farming activities

loans.name: Margelis

texts.en:
Margelis is 37 years old and lives with her partner and three daughters in the municipality of Sahagun. Her beautiful daughters are 12, 10 and 4 years old, and are the light of her eyes. She works hard so she can give to her family a good life, something that she didn’t have when she was younger because of the needs that her family had.

She owns a raising cattle business since 2012, and is the only support that her family has, that’s why she wants to see her business last in time so it can keep providing her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy 3 pigs and to make some locative adjustments.

Margelis has big dreams that especially regard her daughter, because she wants to see them grow up as good people that can do great things for them and other people. You can help this devoted mother to accomplish her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: buy 3 pigs and to make some locative adjustments

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bienvenida is 62 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Bienvenida has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Bienvenida has been in this business for 10 years. Bienvenida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. She has been in the business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines for 3 years now. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nakhaen Group

texts.en: See understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. See knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter See purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. See is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Phonngam Group

texts.en: Khasone is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Khasone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Khasone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Khasone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Khasone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Godua

texts.fr: Godua est une femme mariée âgée de 56 ans résidant à Baguida avec quatre enfants à charge. Godua vend des nattes pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice de son activité. Godua s’approvisionne deux fois  par mois au marché et désire commander le nécessaire pour la confection de ses nattes. Avec la marge la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Godua  pourra soutenir son mari dans les charges  de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Godua is a married woman aged 56, raising four children and living in Baguida. She sells woven mats so that she can cover the needs of her children, thanks to the profits from her business.

Godua buys new supplies twice a month at the market, and she would like to order the necessary materials to make her mats. With the profit she will make, Godua will be able to help her husband with the family's expenses and permit her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy six piles of the material she uses to weave her mats.

loans.name: Thabok Group

texts.en: Home’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Home and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. Home and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Home’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongkhae Group

texts.en:
Mang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating the local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Mang and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Mang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Mang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

Mang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

loans.use: buy water filters to produce safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lark 7 Group

texts.en: Khamta understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Khamta knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khamta purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Khamta is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Karpagam And Group

texts.en:
Karpagam is the leader of a group of 5 women. Santhasheela, Dhanalakshmi, Sujatha and Muthazhahi are the other members of the group.

Karpagam is 43 and a mother of two. She earns her daily wages by doing manual labour on agricultural fields. She wants to supplement her income and ensure there is a more steady source of income to support her family. To this end, she underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation in making wire bags. Now, she, along with the other members in the group are seeking a loan to start a business from home.

Karpagam, Santhasheela and Dhanalakshmi want to start a wire bag making business while the other members will start home-based businesses in making mixed spice powders. The income from the business will help them boost their income, and save more in the long run, for their children's education, and for any emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her wire bag making business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que tuvo muchas dificultades, pero que ha ido superando por medio de su esfuerzo.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder crecer y salir adelante y también ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Ybycui and is studying towards a career in business administration. He comments that he has had many difficulties, but he continues to overcome them through his efforts.

By means of his studies in business administration Jorge hopes to be able to grow and get ahead. Also, he wants to help his family and his loved ones.

Now, Jorge is requesting a loan so that he can pay his current university fees, thus enabling him to continue his studies, and his struggle to become someone special in life.

loans.use: pay his university fees.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Jessica would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from goat fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 45 years old and married and has four children, two of whom in school. Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cristelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cristelita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.  Cristelita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Cristelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme divorcée habitant à Baguida. Agée de 49 ans, Akossiwa  a quatre enfants à charge. Akossiwa est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa propre boutique à domicile. Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des poissons fumés, des oignons et du piment afin de réaliser plus de revenus pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a divorced woman living in Baguida. Aged 49, she is raising four children. Akossiwa sells food and she buys her supplies twice a month at the market and resells the food in her own little shop at her home.

Akossiwa is asking for this loan to order smoked fish, onions, and hot peppers so as to make more income to support her children and cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of smoked fish, eight piles of onions, and three bags of hot peppers.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is a 53 years old man with a wife and four children all living with him.
Freddie is basically a teacher and does agriculture such as growing of maize and coffee. He is a hard working man who has seen been able to achieve a lot from teaching and the farming.
More still, Freddie is involved in poultry farming and through this he has been able to construct a permanent home and educated his children.

He will use the loan to buy poultry and freeds. According to him, his main challenge is price fluctuation which has led to a loss of capital through it.

loans.use: To buy poultry and feeds

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is a 33-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care, who resides in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked as a factory worker since 2005. Her husband is a 34-year-old blacksmith. Sa and her husband can make around $11 per day.

She has decided to take out a loan because she needs money to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy a cow. Her future plans are to expand her husband's business, renovate her house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, who is a 48-year-old married man, lives in the Ambrolauri district. He has a wife, a pensioner mother, a school-aged son and a student daughter. His wife is a doctor with an ambulance and also works privately through the district. Davit works at the local assembly and gets a fixed salary. He is also involved in agribusiness, which is a profitable activity and Davit has a great desire to expand it. Nowadays, he harvests grapes and nuts and sells wine at the local market.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Davit to get a loan of 3700 GEL and start beekeeping. He will purchase bees and start selling honey at a good price. He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family.

Davit is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to get more income from his agribusiness.

loans.use: to start beekeeping and expand his agricultural activity.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, age 58 and married, is charged with the responsibility of taking care of 20 children, four of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into selling general merchandise, such as cooking oil, salt, sugar, and soap, among other items, on a retail basis. In order to earn an additional income, he started rearing pigs and dealing in poultry-keeping. He intends to develop and expand his business more, so as to become a wholesaler. He is seeking a loan to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell on a retail basis.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Ka Dar Village Group

texts.en:
Hla, from Ka Dar Village Group, is 41 years old and lives with her family of seven. She has two children, studying on primary and secondary educations. The parents want their children to be well educated and have a better future. She takes care of house chores and does tailoring in her village while her husband farms and looks after the livestock. The loan will help the family purchase duck food and other farming necessities. They have many years of duck raising experience and hope their businesses flows smoothly. 

Pictured above are the members from Ka Dar Village Group: Hla, Thu, Ohm, Aung and Nwe. This loan will help other members purchase ducks and vaccines which will make the ducks healthy and more productive. 

Ka Dar Village is located in Myanmar’s Ayeyarwaddy River Delta region. Besides duck farming, villagers fish, do tailoring and agricultural production as businesses. Most households raise animals as livestock or business.

loans.use: to purchase duck food.

loans.name: Namlo Group

texts.en: Thongphet’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Thongphet and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Thongphet and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Thongphets family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He grew up with his five siblings in Rwanda's capital, Kigali, where he relied on friends and family to help him through school. Because of his exceptional academic record and dedication, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Angelo chose Kepler because of its reputation for job placement and rigorous curriculum. He will be the first in his family to attend university.

Angelo plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. His hobbies include programming, reading, and playing chess. After graduating, Angelo hopes to give back to his community by creating jobs.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Tatenda

texts.en: Tatenda is a 26-year-old business lady who lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe.  She runs a flourishing poultry business that has resulted in her being the pillar of the family when it comes to contributing financial resources.  Tatenda inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.  She intends to expand her poultry business using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva.  An increase in income will enable her to support herself and to create employment for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks to rear and sell.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is a permanent resident of Bumbu Kitezi, a suburb of Kampala. She is a married woman with two children. The two children are both at university, one in her final year and another one in the first year. She is a hardworking woman to the extent that she is the one paying the daughters' tuition at the university.

She does a number of services in her salon and this includes hair dressing, manicures and pedicures. She uses this business as her main source of income to cater for her family and pay school fees for the children.

Hasifa wants to expand her business by borrowing 1,500,000 UGX. She is a first time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. She has got a high number of customers, and she needs more cosmetics to meet their demands and now opted to borrow a small loan because she wants to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
After having 5 years experience as an outdoor sales representative, Leila opened her own shop one year ago, where she sells underwear, hair gel and home cleaning supplies. She is Lebanese, living in Tripoli with her husband. Together they have 4 sons and 2 daughters, who are just as hard-working as their parents. While Leila's husband works in sanitary product sales, her eldest son works in a popular restaurant in the area and the middle one works in a coffee shop. Her other children are in their last years of high school and will be graduating in the upcoming years.

Leila is 57 years old and, after raising her 6 children, she is now focusing on supporting her husband in covering the family expenses. She is asking for a 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She is planning on using the amount to buy new supplies to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Nothing Is Impossible - N10Lthànhđhải Group

texts.en:
Giao is 53 years old and she is married. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for five years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could be dead so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with her finances.

The main hardship that Giao faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Before borrowing money from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, she had just been a farmer. Her income was really low so it was very difficult for her to cover the life costs. In 2014, Giao joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She used her loans to invest in raising poultry and her life is also better. Giao has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Giao is the group leader of N10LThànhĐHải, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Giao hopes to maintain a successful business, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Roin

texts.en: Roin is 39 years old from the Khelvachauri district. He lives with his parents, wife and two children. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow citrus and sell seasonally. Roin decided to start a new business along with his agricultural activities and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan. With the received credit, Roin will purchase all the needed materials to build a cottage and rent it out and get a stable income. Roin is very motivated to start a new business and hopes it will be profitable.

loans.use: to build a cottage in order to rent it out and get income

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old. He is married to Jane who is a business lady and they are blessed with two children. He has had a transportation business for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. John has borrowed KES 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan after successfully paying his previous loan. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorbike for transporting passengers. John hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to pay school fees for his children, buy food for the family, expand his current business and repay his loan. His hopes and dreams for the future are to excel economically through the expansion of his business as well as enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.en: Jyambere is a group led by Fortunee, who is 45 years old. The group name means “Vision” in English. Fortunee is married and has five children aged between 5 and 22 years old. She owns a shop and has been doing this business for the past 12 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Isaki

texts.en:
Isaki is a 25-year-old young man from Kutaisi city. He lives with his parents and the only employed person is his father, who is a psychologist. Isaki was unable to start any stable job in spite of his high education. In order to get financial independence, Isaki decided to be involved in his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Isaki applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses. With the received amount of 1600 USD, Isaki plans to purchase special machinery of an auto crane, rent the place and start repairing cars. He will get clients among local people and will generate some income and he will also help his father to lead the family more effectively.

With the support of the Start Up program, Isaki will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties. He needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase an auto crane and start repairing cars.

loans.name: Moon Light Gayaza School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Uthman. He is the head teacher of Moon Light Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Gayaza in Wakiso with 450 students. Moon Light School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Moon Light School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Uthman ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases. He hopes it will also increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for rice farm preparation and to buy fertilizers.

Rutchel has been farming rice for five years and also earns income from rice retailing. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for rice farm preparation and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser un buen profesional y por medio de sus conocimientos poder ayudar a las demás personas, por medio de su anterior préstamo pudo poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Él pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Carlos is pursuing his law degree, and he says that he is putting forth his best effort to become a good professional and, through his knowledge, be able to help other people.

With his previous loan, he was able to pay his tuition fees, and thus continue his education.

He is requesting this new loan to be able to make his tuition payments again and, in this way, continue studying and working hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Takunda

texts.en: Takunda is a 19-year-old successful business lady who sells clothes at a flea market in her local community. This business has allowed her and her family to develop and has also made her become a role model to the other young women in her community. Using the proceeds from this clothing business, Takunda has been managing to pay school fees for her siblings and meet the financial needs of her family. She has also managed to diversify into the poultry rearing business which she intends to expand with the repeat loan that she is requesting from KIVA. This would also enable her to create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis viene de una familia humilde, está estudiando la carrera de arquitectura, y comenta que sus metas son la de graduarse de Arquitecto, ser un profesional y así salir adelante y ayudar a su familia que le apoya en todo momento.
En el futuro se ve como profesional reconocido y renombrado y útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder estar más cerca de cumplir con sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Alexis comes from a humble family. He is studying toward an architecture degree, and he says that his goals are to graduate as an architect and be a professional in order to get ahead and help his family, who always support him.

In the future, he sees himself as a recognized professional, renowned and useful to society.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay tuition for his degree so that he can be closer to fulfilling his wishes.

loans.use: to make tuition payments toward his degree

loans.name: Caqui Group

texts.es:
Grupo Caqui, conformado por 3 jóvenes emprendedoras, quienes están por primera vez con ADIM y solicitando a los miembros de KIVA, crédito para el desarrollo de sus negocios. 

Coordinado por Jackeline, de 23 años, acompañada y con 2 hijas de edades 4 años y 8 meses. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y calzado desde hace 2 años, con la ayuda de su pareja. Requiere del crédito para la compra de productos como pantalones de mujeres, pantalones de varones, blusas, camisetas y calzado para niños y adulto. Entre sus metas esta hacer más grande el negocio.
Las otras socias son María, 20 años dedicada a la venta de productos varios como ropa, shores, sabanas, de manera ambulante en las comarcas. Y Ana, 22 años tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Grupo Caqui is made up of 3 young entrepreneurs who are in their first loan cycle and asking Kiva members to help them invest in their businesses.

Jackeline is the coordinator of the group. She is 23 years old, she lives with her significant other and they have two daughters. The oldest is 4 years old and the youngest is 8 months old. She makes a living by selling new clothing and footwear. She has two years of experience. Her significant other helps her. She needs a loan in order to purchase items such as men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses and footwear for children and adults. Growing her business is among her goals in life.

The other members of the group are Maria who is 20 years old and sells clothing and bed sheets as a street vendor in the neighboring areas. Ana is 22 years old and runs a grocery store from her home, she has 4 years of experience.

loans.use: purchase women's and men's pants, shirts and blouses as well as footwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, ella es empleada de una empresa de ventas de electrodomésticos y está cursando el último  año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas. 
Ella es una persona luchadora que pone todo de si para poder ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, para que de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Luz is from the city of Curuguaty. She studies and works at the same time. She works at a business that sells domestic appliances and she is also enrolled in her last year of schooling for a degree in Business Administration.

She is a hard working person who gives it her all. She wants to help her loved ones once she begins her career.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest in paying the costs associated with finishing her thesis/degree.

loans.use: To pay costs associated with completing her thesis/degree.

loans.name: El Sonido Del Silencio Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨El sonido del Silencio¨, conformado por 6 personas dueñas de sus pequeños negocios. Solicitando por primera vez a los miembros KIVA, crédito para poder salir adelante. 
 
La líder del grupo es Ángela, de 19 años, a su corta edad tiene su negocio de destace de cerdo quien lo distribuye de manera ambulante. Acompañada y con hijo a su responsabilidad de 3 meses, solicita del crédito para la compra de dos cerdos para así criarlos y después comercializar su carne y sus derivados. Su meta principal es la superación de su negocio. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Engracia, 30 años, dedicada a la venta de gaseosa, cigarro, hielo, pan, cosecha de tamarindo. Karla, 22 años, al destace de cerdo y crianza desde hace 2 años. Máxima, 28 años al destace de cerdo. Carlos, 21  años, a la venta de cosechas de limón y Rosalina, 26 años venta de tomate, cebolla y chiltoma
texts.en:
The group ¨El sonido del Silencio¨ (The Sound of Silence), is made up of 6 members who all have their own small businesses. They are in their first loan cycle and asking Kiva members to help them invest in their future.

The leader of the group is Angela. She is 19 years old, but even in her young age she has been able to start her own business as a butcher. She lives with her significant other and they have a son who is 3 months old She is asking for this loan in order to purchase pigs that she will raise and then sell their meat and other products. Her principal goal in life is to run a successful business.

The other members of the group are Engracia who is 30 years old and makes a living selling sodas, cigarettes, ice, bread and tamarind fruits. Karla is 22 years old and runs a business raising pigs, she has 2 years of experience. Maxima is 28 years old and also runs a business raising pigs. Carlos is 21 years old and he sells lemons. Rosalina is 26 years old and sells tomatoes, onions and chiles.

loans.use: purchase pigs in order to raise and then sell their meat.

loans.name: Kigando Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Eric is a member of Kigando Abeteraine Group, where members guarantee each other for a loan as they do not offer security. He is a 53-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He owns a retail shop and at the same time is a farmer growing food crops like banana, cassava and sweet potatoes. The business has been able to cater for the family with food and other basic needs.

He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations that hinder expansion of his business. However, he is looking forward to expanding his business to involve wholesale business.

Eric needs a loan to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en: Tecla is a 20 year old business lady who operates a grocery shop in Guruve District in Zimbabwe. She has also just started a poultry business that she intends to expand with the loan that she is requesting from KIVA.  Tecla inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.  An increase in income will enable her to support herself and to create employment for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broilers to rear and sell.

loans.name: Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en: TURWANYUBUKENE, which in English means “Fight Against Poverty”, is a group led by Donathile, who is 38 years old. She is married and has five children aged between 2 and 15 years. She sells sorghum and has been doing this business for the past 6 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, Donathile would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Marie Geneviève

texts.fr: Marie est une femme âgée de 52 ans résidant à Baguida. Veuve, Marie a un enfant à charge. Marie est une revendeuse  de chaussures et des céréales qui s’approvisionne et les  revendent  quatre fois par mois au marché. Marie demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat de tapettes pour homme, femme et du maïs afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Marie is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Baguida. A widow, Marie has one child in her care. Marie resells shoes and grains that she stocks and resells four times a month at the market.

Marie is asking for this loan to purchase men's and women's flipflops and corn in order to help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of men's flipflops, one box of women's flipflops, and one bag of corn.

loans.name: Zhumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул, 26 лет, замужем, есть 3 сыновей. Она ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 6 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, и участок мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhumagul is 26 years old, married, and has three sons. For the past six years she has run her own business to provide the family's primary source of income. Thanks to her persistence she now owns two cows and one hectare of land where she grows corn. Her monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Zhumagul is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 20,000 som (KGS) loan to expand her livestock herd and cultivate her land. Zhumagul plans to invest income from the loan into further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Joelle

texts.en: Joelle is a 19-year-old single lady who started almost a year ago working as a saleswoman in a shoes and bags shop to cover her needs and expenses, especially her educational expenses. She is a clever and ambitious university student. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees for her second year studying sociology. She hopes to finish her studies and open her own business in the future.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees for her second year studying sociology

loans.name: Neerwaya 01 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANÇOIS est le responsable du groupe NEERWATA 01 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a  03 mois. 03 enfants vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 17 ans et pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir  dans son activité. Il ambitionne augmenter son activité, développer d’autres activités et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. François is the leader of the group called Neerwata 01 Sapone. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest just three months old. Three of his children attend school and he is responsible for six persons.

François has been raising livestock for 17 years and he also works in agriculture. He buys his supplies in the surrounding markets. With the loan money, he intends to buy four pigs. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his activity. His ambition is to grow his activity, develop other activities, and ensure schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Andrea requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more varieties of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Andrea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Esther joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Esther suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Esther will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will allow her to increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Esther now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la cuidad de Caacupé. Las 15 integrantes del comité realizan trabajos para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La señora Maria, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de comidas que realiza en su casa, es una mujer muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y que desea seguir ayudando a su familia y por eso forma parte de este grupo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de comidas, y poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo y otros productos para poder continuar con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Virgen de Fatima is in its second loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. The group is located in the city of Caacupé, and its 15 members follow different occupations to be able to help each other.

Maria provides for her family by selling meals that she prepares at her home. She is a very selfless woman, who is getting ahead through her hard work, and who wants to continue supporting her family. For this reason, she joined this group.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her food business and purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, chicken, and other products to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, chicken, and other products to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Yamil Isaac

texts.es:
Yamil es una persona tranquila, sociable y luchador. Por primera vez esta con ADIM, y los miembros de KIVA, para poder desarrollar su microempresa de elaboración de calzado y a la venta de pan. Con 33 años de edad, casado y con un hijo a su cargo, ha podido construir su taller, desde hace 12 años, con los ahorros que tuvo cuando trabajaba en otros talleres. 

Ahora finalmente se siente orgulloso por poder manejar su producción, requiere del préstamo para poder comprar materia prima fundamentales en el proceso de calzado y pan, como hormas, fibras, forro fino, cerquillo, esponja, cuero, remache, hilo, pega blanca y amarilla,mantequilla, azúcar, queso, levadura, leña y mejoras  de construcción al horno. 
Seguro de que con todos estos materiales su producción será diversificada y de calidad conquistando a su clientela.
texts.en:
Yamil is an easy going, friendly, and hard working person. He's 33 years old and has a wife and child in his care. He's come to ADIM and to Kiva members for the first time so that he can develop his small business making shoes and selling bread. He was able to start his shop twelve years ago with the savings he earned working in other shops. These days, he's very proud of being able to manage his production.

He needs this loan to purchase starting materials for the process of making shoes, including lasts (shoe molds), synthetic and natural thread, quality lining, fringes, sponges, leather, rivets, white and yellow glue. He will also buy products for making bread, like butter, sugar, cheese, and yeast, and make some improvements to his oven.

He is sure that with these materials, he can diversify his production, and his high quality will earn him more customers.

loans.use: stock his two business making shoes and bread

loans.name: Happy-Go-Lucky - N12Thảiqnham Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 29 years old, and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years. Thảo lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by the local government as low-income, moreover market demand is low in this region. The main hardship that Thảo faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2012, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thảo has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thảo is the group leader of N12THảiQNham, which consists of 4 members.  With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita, a 55-year-old married mother of five, has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for five years now. A recipient of seven previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new loan for PHP 13000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz, a 24-year-old man, lives in Kutaisi city. He has a wife and little children. Murtaz works hard to provide financial stability and good living conditions for his family, but he gets a really small salary from working as an accountant for a private organization.

Murtaz has a great desire to increase his productivity somehow and earn his own business income. He decided to open his own office as an accountant and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempt was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1300 GEL for purchasing a printer, a table and a chair for his new office. Murtaz will start serving his own loyal customers from his own office and will generate more income.

The loan will greatly assist Murtaz, and he will be able to continue the job he loves. Due to his kind and nice attitude toward clients, Murtaz has a big list of loyal customers. He will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to open his own office as an accountant, purchasing a printer, a table, and a chair for his new office.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir's wife has had four other surgeries in the past. To earn a living, Vladimir has been doing agricultural activities and also works for a monthly pay of roughly $170 while his wife receives disability income.

Note that Vladimir has been a VFA client for a long time and this would be his fifth loan. He has proved to be a reliable client.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's surgery that has already been scheduled to happen soon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution for her small unit.

loans.name: Miritourou Group

texts.fr: DEGOUBERE est l’homme qui a la corde  du mouton en main  sur la photo, DEGOUBERE est un malien, scolarisé, âgé de cinquante-un (51) ans et marié, père de six (6) enfants dont deux (2) sont scolarisés, les enfants sont  âgés de six (6)  à trente (30) ans. DEGOUBERE est un agriculteur et éleveur d’ovin qui fait recourt au RMCR parce que c’est plus favorisant  et aussi humanitaire, il prend ce prêt dans le but d’acheter beaucoup de moutons pour les élevés et les revendre au comptant sur le marché local. Avec ses bénéfices il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il exercé cette activité depuis seize (16) ans. DEGOUBERE  a comme rêve et espoir  d’avoir beaucoup de profit dans l’avenir pour acheter  de la  nourriture  suffisante et scolarisé ses enfants dans les conditions acceptables  en faisant recourt au prêt du RMCR.
texts.en:
Degoubere is the man with the goat's leash in his hand in the photo. Degoubere is a 51-year old, educated Malian, who is married and has 6 children, two of which are educated. His children range in ages from six to thirty years old. Degoubere has a farmer and raises goats. He is requesting the help of RMCR because it is more favorable and humanitarian. He is taking this loan with the goal of buying a lot of goats to raise and sell for profit at the local market.

With the profit he obtains, he strives to meet his family's needs and to support his children's education.

He has been working in this profession for 16 years. Degoubere dreams and hopes to have much more profit in the future in order to buy enough food and to educate his children in acceptable conditions through requesting a loan with RMCR.

est l’homme qui a la corde du mouton en main sur la photo, DEGOUBERE est un malien, scolarisé, âgé de cinquante-un (51) ans et marié, père de six (6) enfants dont deux (2) sont scolarisés, les enfants sont âgés de six (6) à trente (30) ans.
