DEGOUBERE est un agriculteur et éleveur d’ovin qui fait recourt au RMCR parce que c’est plus favorisant et aussi humanitaire, il prend ce prêt dans le but d’acheter beaucoup de moutons pour les élevés et les revendre au comptant sur le marché local. Avec ses bénéfices il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il exercé cette activité depuis seize (16) ans. DEGOUBERE a comme rêve et espoir d’avoir beaucoup de profit dans l’avenir pour acheter de la nourriture suffisante et scolarisé ses enfants dans les conditions acceptables en faisant recourt au prêt du RMCR.

loans.use: to buy goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a 21-year-old businesswoman, wife and mother from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. For the past two years, she has been successfully buying and selling jackets, shirts, skirts, lingerie, and underwear. This business has helped her and her family.

In addition to the clothing business, Ellen runs a poultry enterprise that she intends to expand using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This will also enable her to create employment for the community.

loans.use: To purchase more broilers to rear and sell.

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Violeta”, integrado por 3 personas que se asociaron con los préstamos de ADIM, para poder emprender y salir adelante con sus negocios teniendo como principal meta poder crecer económicamente. 
La líder del grupo es Manuela, 25 años, casada y con un hijo de 4 años, se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas y venta de pan de manera ambulante, desde hace 3 años. Con la ayuda de su esposo empezó a vender y noto las ganancias que generaba para aportar a los gastos familiares. Es por eso que ahora requiere aumentar su producción y con el crédito comprara leña, quintales de maíz. Esperanzada a que su negocio crezca. Las demás socias son Cinthy de 25 años, quien elabora y prepara comida fritanguera comercializando de manera ambulante. Aracelly, 20 años vende comida en su hogar.
texts.en:
"Violeta" is a group made of three people who have come together with ADIM loans so that they can grow and get ahead with their small businesses. Their primary goal is economic growth.

The leader of the group is Manuela, age 25, who is married and has a four-year-old son. She runs a mobile business of making and selling tortillas, and she has three years of experience. With help from her husband, she began her sales and noticed the earnings she made helped to support the family's expenses.

She's now looking to expand her production, and with this loan, she'll purchase firewood and large sacks of corn. She hopes to grow her business. The other members of the group are Cinthy, age 25, who makes fried foods and sells them around town; and Aracelly, age 20, who sells food out of her home.

loans.use: expand her business of making and selling tortillas

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
Suzel is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.

Suzel has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Neerwata 04 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr FRANÇOIS est le responsable du groupe  NEERWATA 04 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de  11 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 09 enfants vont à l’école et il a 11 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’agriculture depuis 20 ans  et pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 01 moto pompe. 
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner enfin de pouvoir agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. François is the head of the group NEERWATA 04 SAPONE. He is married with 11 children ages 4 to 30, nine of whom go to school. He supports 11 people.

Mr. François has been a farmer for 20 years, and he is also a breeder. He makes his purchases at various local markets. He plans to use this loan to buy a motor pump.

He will save his profits to expand his business. He also wants to pay for his children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy a motor pump.

loans.name: Imbaraga Group

texts.en:
Apolinarie is 47 years and a married mother of six children between 15 and 26 years of age. She leads the group called IMBARAGA, which means “POWER” in English. The members sell various products and wish to expand their businesses to ensure better futures.

Apolinarie, who has owned a butcher shop for 20 years, will use her loan portion to buy more cows for meat. She will use her profits to buy a car in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more cows for her butcher shop business

loans.name: Leze

texts.en: In the picture is Leze and her husband, Ndue, who want to buy a dairy cow. Living with them is their son's family of four. Leze and Ndue adore their grandsons and this became evident during the interview when they never stopped talking about the little ones. Their plan is to add another cow with your loan, so that their grandsons' living conditions improve.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esria

texts.en: Esria is a 20-year-old business lady who operates a grocery shop in the Guruve District in Zimbabwe. She has also just started a poultry business that she intends to expand with the loan that she is requesting from Kiva.  Esria inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur.  An increase in income will enable her to support herself and to create employment for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a solar solution for her business

loans.name: 17 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨17 de julio¨, este grupo diversificado están por primera vez, solicitando crédito a ADIM y los miembros de KIVA, para la mejora de sus vidas económicamente. 

Idalia, es la líder del grupo de 47 años, soltera, y con 5 hijos, quien expresa que son su fuente de superación para seguir adelante. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a elaboración y venta de vestidos, para comercializarlos, este negocio lo comenzó con el dinero que recogió del trabajo anterior.  En su pequeño taller ella y dos trabajadoras más elaboran variedades de vestidos. Con el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tela, hilo, zypers, botones, cinta, éntrelas y agujas. Así cubrirá la demanda su clientela.
Los otros integrantes son Ángela, 29 años prepara y vende comida desde hace 1 año. Santiago de 23 años tiene una panadería en su domicilio. Indiana, 44 años se dedica a la venta de cerámicas en barro y a la venta de plátanos.  Yasuara, 28 años quien vende mochilas de sacos.
texts.en:
The diverse group "17 de julio" [17th of July] is, for the first time, asking for a loan from ADIM and the members of KIVA to better their lives economically. Idalia is the leader of the group and is 47 years old. She lives alone with 5 children, whom she says are the source of her desire to improve and move forward. For 25 years now she has made a living by creating and selling dresses, as well as marketing them. She started this business with money she earned from her previous job. In her small studio, she and two other workers make a variety of dresses. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, ribbon, interlining and needles. In this way, she will cover her clients' demand.

The other members are: Ángela who is 29 and has been preparing and selling food for one year, Santiago who is 23  and has a bakery in his house, Indiana who is 44 and makes a living selling clay pottery and selling bananas, and Yasuara who is 28 and sells backpacks.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, ribbon, interlining and needles

loans.name: Kuña Aty De Costa Rosado Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty de Costa Rosado, está integrado  por  25 mujeres están en  el octavo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan  ya que se encuentran en la misma comunidad, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Ulvina quien tiene una despensa, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy tarde en la noche, es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio ha podido crecer en su negocio. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que decidió unirse al grupo para poder capacitarse y seguir mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, lácteos, panificados, y otros productos variados, para poder surtir su negocio con todo lo que sus clientes piden. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Aty de Costa Rosado" is made up of 25 women, who all work and help each other, since they're in the same community. The group is in its eighth loan cycle in the women's committee, a program to eliminate poverty, fighting to grow and improve.

One of the members is Ulvina, who runs a small store. She works every day from very early in the morning until very late at night. She's a hard working woman who has been able to grow her business through her sacrifices. She wants to keep growing, so she decided to join this group so that she could get training and keep improving.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables, meat, dairy products, breads, and other assorted goods and stock her business with what her customers demand. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her small business.

loans.use: stock her small store with groceries like vegetables, meat, and dairy products

loans.name: Abdl-Mugheth

texts.en:
Abdl-Mugheth is a 21-years-old single young man from Nablus city. His father works as a carpenter where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.
Abdl is a student at the university where he studies Interior Design . He wants to take his BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.
Abdl took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Abdl will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.
Abdl appears in the photo.

loans.use: to help pay the first year registration and university fees for his BA in Interior Design.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 24-year-old young woman from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She and her sister live alone and both are involved in private activities, as they were unable to start any stable job. Maia works as a nurse and her sister is a private teacher. They get a small income that is hardly enough to meet even their basic needs. Maia decided to make another source of income and start trading bed linens. She requested a loan from local financial institutions but without any success, as the creditors didn't find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 950 USD for purchasing a stock of bed linens at wholesale prices in Turkey. She will then sell with a price mark-up in her community.

Maia will be able to make her work more productive and improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support and kindness and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of bed linens and start a trading business.

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en:
Shefqet last year divorced his wife and has full custody of his three children.

"I live with my mother and my three children now. My mother helps me a lot with the kids, because being a single father is not easy at all. And on top of it, I have to work to bring an income home; I work in construction. I do house painting and I only have one kidney," said Shefqet to the branch assistant.

Shefqet will use this loan to do some minor repairs to the family home.

loans.use: to do some minor repairs to the family's home

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is originally from the Dominican Republic and lives with her three kids. She runs and owns a business that specializes in providing private transportation services to families that rely on third parties to drive their kids to school. Maria decided to start her business when she realized that it would be an opportunity to be in control of her future and destiny.

Her greatest success as the owner of her business has been the increased demand for her service. She and her full-time employee operate her business together and she is grateful for the diversity in clientele that count on her business.

Maria is currently seeking a loan to purchase an additional vehicle she can use as back up in the case of an emergency or when unexpected car problems arise. Her vision for the future is to continue expanding her business as much as she possibly can. She is motivated to continue working hard and is proud to be a successful business owner in an industry that is highly dominated by men.

loans.use: to purchase an additional vehicle to help meet the demands of her business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a university graduate, aged 26, who is applying for a loan of 4,000,000/=. She is a single lady and a businesswoman operating a retail shop. After her studies, she looked for jobs but failed to get one in a spell of two years, and thought of starting up her own business. She shared the idea with her parents, who managed to give her a little money that she used to start up a small retail shop. With the business knowledge she acquired from university, she was able to run the business, which gradually went on expanding to what it is now, a bigger retail shop.

Because Lillian is a very shrewd and aggressive woman, she wants to buy off another retail shop, adjacent to hers, which is for sale. Since Lillian badly needs the retail shop, she came to UGAFODE microfinance, her financial institution, to be advanced the 4,000,000/= that they need to sell off the shop.

She has future hopes of becoming a strong and famous entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy a retail shop

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.en:
Ana Cristina is an artisan from Peru who specializes in hand-crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver, gemstones and leather.

Ana Cristina has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

Since childhood, Ana Cristina spent most of her time drawing. "I had always wanted to learn jewelry design, and I finally took a two-year course. Then I followed my husband, who traveled frequently to Bogota. There I gained experience in jewelry workshops and learned practically every technique. Each stone inspires my designs.

"I'd like to thank everyone who supports me through this microcredit, which will allow me to acquire the materials I need to craft my pieces and keep up with demand."

Use the link below to view Ana Cristina's hand-crafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5131

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including silver, gemstones and leather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution for her stitching unit

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 57 years old vigorous, married woman and mother of three. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone.

Mumtaz ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to enlarge her business, so she requested a loan of 50000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in larger quantities, to meet the increasing demand for her work. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities, to meet the increasing demand time after time.

loans.name: Korhai Group

texts.en: Mameevan is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Mameevan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Mameevan and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Mameevan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Mameevan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar solution for her business unit.

loans.name: Previous

texts.en: Previous is 26 years old. She is married with one child and resides in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Previous has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Previous rents a shop at the local business center where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  She has diversified to a poultry production project, which seems to be more lucrative than the shop. With the loan that she is requesting, Previous hopes to increase the number of broiler birds that she keeps from 100 broiler birds every six weeks to 200 broiler birds every three weeks. This would enable her to maximize her profits and even create employment for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Jean Emile

texts.fr:
Jean Emile est un brave père de famille. Il est dynamique, responsable , diligent quand il est question de bien-être de ses  enfants. Il est marié et les deux époux exercent ensemble l'activité de mûrisserie de bananes. C'est Jean Emile qui assure l'approvisionnement et la mûrisserie et sa femme s'occupe de la vente. Avant 2000, il ne faisait que l'achat et revente mais depuis lors, il commençait à effectuer la mûrisserie, car c'est plus intéressant et plus bénéfique. A part cette activité, il exploite aussi de l'élevage de poulet de chair et de cochon.
C'est un père de famille débrouillard et très courageux, il quatre enfants à charge ,âgés de 9mois à 16 ans. La famille a déjà sa propre maison mais le prochain objectif est d'acheter une voiture bâchée ou camionnette pour l'approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Jean Emile is a brave family man. He is dynamic, responsible, and diligent when it comes to the well-being of his children. He is married and works with his spouse ripening the bananas. Jean Emile secures the supply and ripening and his wife takes care of the sales.

Before 2000, he only did purchasing and resale, but nowadays, he started to work with ripening, because it's more interesting and profitable. Aside from that business, he also raises chickens and pigs for profit.

This family man is very courageous and resourceful. He takes care of four children, ages 9 month to 16 years. The family already has its own house, but the next goal is to buy a covered care or little truck for supplying.

loans.use: to buy green bananas.

loans.name: Diamantina Auxiliadora

texts.es: Orgullosa de buscar su propio ingresos económicos, esta Doña Diamantina, de 52 años de edad, acompañada y apoyada por su pareja, tiene su taller de costura desde hace 20 años, gracias a los ahorros que obtuvo cuando trabajaba en otros talleres. Ahora para aumentar su producción y cubrir la demanda requiere del préstamo para comprar telas y una maquina industrial, adornos, zypers, botones para la elaboración de faldas y pantalones. Aprovechando así la temporada de las fiestas patrias que se aproximan en el país. Y mejorar su ganancias.
texts.en:
Diamantina is 52 years old and lives with and is supported by her partner. Proud to seek her own economic revenue, she has had her own sewing business for 20 years, thanks to the savings she acquired while working in others' shops.

Now in order to increase her production and meet demand, she needs a loan to buy fabric, an industrial machine, trim, zippers and buttons to make skirts and pants. In this way she can take advantage of the upcoming patron saint festivals in her country, and better her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, an industrial sewing machine, trim, zippers and buttons for making skirts and pants.

loans.name: Neerwaya 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA est le responsable du groupe  NEERWATA  02 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et il a 12 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’élevage  depuis 12 ans, il pratique aussi l’agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Moussa is the Neerwata 02 Sapone Group's leader. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 3. Three children go to school, and he is responsible for 12 people.

Moussa has been raising livestock for 12 years. He also a farmer. He purchases supplies at the nearby markets.

With this loan, he intends to purchase four sheep.

He would like to use the profits to reinvest in his business. He hopes to become a rancher.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Epitacia

texts.en:
Epitacia is 61 years old and married. Epitacia works very hard to provide for them.

Epitacia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like hair conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Epitacia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as hair conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Epitacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like hair conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 48 years old and married with two children. 

Flor is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Flor requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Flor has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Flor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 24-year-old business woman from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, where she teaches life skills and cooperative learning to students. To support her family, Cynthia operates a stall at a local flea market and sells shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, shoes, slippers, baby clothes, and jewellery.

She has diversified to poultry production, which seems to be more lucrative than the flea market. With the loan that she is requesting, Cynthia intends to increase the number of road runner birds that she keeps. This would enable her to maximize her profits and even create employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase more road runner chickens to rear and sell.

loans.name: Vololonirina Elisa

texts.fr: 44 ans, mère de trois enfants de 4 à 20 ans, Vololoniaina Elisa est une femme divorcée qui élève seule ses enfants. Elle exerce une activité de vente de fournitures de bureau et fournitures scolaires pour gagner sa vie. C'est une femme courageuse, travailleuse ayant de la ténacité. Le prêt va lui permettre de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir améliorer son revenu. Notons que le père de ses enfants ne lui verse aucune pension alimentaire. Sa priorité actuelle est le bien-être de ses enfants: leurs études , leurs avenirs. Son désir est de leur offrir une meilleure condition de vie malgré l'absence d'un père, de son amour et de son soutien moral et financier.
texts.en:
44 years old, mother of three children ages 4 to 20, Vololonirina Elisa is a divorced single mother. She works selling desk supplies and school supplies for a living. She is a courageous, industrious, and tenacious woman.This loan will allow her to bolster her working capital in order to be able to improve her revenue.

The father of the children does not support her or pay any alimony.

Volololonirina's current priority is the well-being of her children: their studies, their futures. Her desire is to offer them better living conditions in spite of a father, of his love, and of his moral and financial support.

loans.use: to buy some notebooks, pens, paper folders, loose-leaf paper, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Joseph is a mature man of forty years old, living with his children and a wife. He is involved in cattle rearing/fattening in his home area.

According to him; he has been in the above activity for over thirty-five years. Alongside that, Joseph is involved in cattle trade which also majorly contributes to his sources of income. According to him, through the above projects Joseph has been able to buy land plus also taking care of his family and sisters.

Joseph has also acquired this loan to boost his cattle fattening business and agriculture business. Joseph says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders. According to him, his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and also, bad weather.

He is described as a hard-working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. Finally he appeals to UGAFODE to lend much more money to him to boost his businesses.

He appreciates the Kiva support and partnership and encourages them to keep up the generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma continua con sus ventas en sus puestos de lomitos, es una mujer muy buena con sus ventas, es luchadora y esta poniendo todo de si para poder ayudar a su familia. comenta que con su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Ella hoy pide este préstamo nuevo para poder refaccionar y equipar su negocio de venta de comidas, para poder dar a sus clientes un buen servicio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Norma continues with her work selling lomitos (steak sandwiches). She's very good with her sales, she's a hard worker, and she gives fully of herself to help her family. She said that she used her previous loan to keep her sales going, as she continues to do.

She is requesting this new loan so that she can improve and equip her business selling food, thus providing her customers with good service. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow and improve.

loans.use: supply her business selling food and make some improvements

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marcelina is 66 years old.

Marcelina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 30 years old and has four children. Jovelyn is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Jovelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jovelyn has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Neerwata 03 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr YAMBA est le responsable du groupe  NEERWATA 03 SAPONE. Il est  marié et père de 13 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 10 enfants vont à l’école et il a 17 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’agriculture depuis 15 ans et pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 20 m de grillage.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour faire de l’élevage. Il ambitionne  assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Yamba is the head of Neerwata 03 Sapone group. He is married and a father to 13 children. The oldest is 25 years old, the youngest is 9 years old. 10 of the children are in school and he has 17 people in his care.

Mr. Yamba has practiced agriculture for 15 years and also raises livestock. He resupplies in the neighboring markets.

With the money borrowed, he plans to buy 20 meters of fencing.

He wants to use the profits of the loan to raise livestock. He strives to insure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy 20 meters of fencing.

loans.name: Hubert-Romain Papaaude

texts.fr:
Mr HUBERT ROMAIN PAPAAUDE est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 15 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école  et il a 01 personne en charge.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis  15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 10 sacs d’engrais et 01 carton d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité de plantation. Il ambitionne  donner un bel avenir à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Hubert Romain Papaaude is married and a father of two children. The oldest one is 18 years old and the youngest is 15 years old. They both go to school and Hubert also has another person in his care.

Hubert has been doing gardening for 15 years. He resupplies at his neighborhood market.

With the money he loans, he plans to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and 1 carton of herbicide.

He wants to use the profits of the loan to grow his gardening business. He strives to provide a beautiful future for his family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and 1 box of herbicide.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Tchilalo est une femme au foyer âgée de 34 ans qui habite à Agoè.  Mère de trois enfants, Tchilalo prépare du  fromage de soja et de la pâte bandée qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Tchilalo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché et nécessite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de soja et de maïs. Grâce à l’épargne qui  résultera, Tchilalo 	 prendra bien soin de ses enfants ainsi que les dépenses quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Tchilalo is a housewife aged 34 who lives in Agoè. The mother of three children, Tchilalo prepares tofu and wrapped dough which she sells in front of her house. She stocks up on supplies three times per month at the market, and she needs this loan to order sacks of soybeans and of maize.

Thanks to the savings that will result from the loan, Tchilalo will take good care of her children and cover their daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy one sack of soybeans and one sack of maize.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es una persona muy sacrificada que se viene esforzando para poder salir adelante, es una persona que pone todo de si para crecer en su negocio de ventas ambulantes, comenta que a través de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar insumos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas ambulantes. Ella por medio de su trabajo mantiene a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para la compra de jeans para damas y caballeros, calzados deportivos, calzas, blusas, capris, shorts, y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alba has sacrificed much and struggles to be able to get shead. She's given fully of herself to grow her business selling clothing at a mobile stand. She said that she used her previous loan to buy necessary supplies to keep up with her sales. Through her work, she is able to maintain her family and loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy men's and women's jeans, athletic shoes, dressy shoes, blouses, capris, shorts, and more so that she can keep up with her sales.

loans.use: buy jeans, shoes, and more for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various drinks to sell such as: wine, beer, sparkling water and other

loans.name: Cordapia

texts.en: Cordapia has been making good sales on her cosmetics and beauty products that she wants to exploit the opportunity of making good fortune out from it. She sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and avails loan product in an amount of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase stocks of cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales, since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for some much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a farmer from Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married with kids of school age. She avails various loans from Paglaum MPC to head up for the nexy cropping season. She avails a loan of PHP 9,950.00 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Jainny

texts.en: Jainny is 63 years old and is known in Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental of her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products for snacks on different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. She had expanded and had increased her production due to high orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC the amount of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others. Jainny believes having enough inventories of the raw materials will not hamper her daily operation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Fe has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Fe has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is very thankful for the loan granted to her by Kiva in the amount of PhP 24,000 to buy 100 quail eggs, 3 bags of ground pork with vegetables, 3 bags of dumplings, and 2 bags of chocolate and fruit flavored powder to sell in her snack vending business. She had increased her income and also able to pay her loan on time. Maylyn also added food items like siopao (steamed buns) and shark fin dumplings in her snack vending business. The revenue of her income helps with their everyday expenses and also with the school expense of her children.

Maylyn is requesting a re-loan in the amount of PhP 25,000 to buy more quail eggs, chicken balls, fish balls, dumplings and steamed buns as added food snacks in her food stall to sell. She need additional income since her oldest child is now at college and the tuition fee is high.

Maylyn is very hopeful that the loan will enable her to increase her income more and able to save for her children school expense. Maylyn is very determined to see her children finish their schooling that she is working very hard.

loans.use: to buy  more quail eggs, chicken balls, fish balls, dumplings and steamed buns as added food snacks in her food stall to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza En Dios Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Esperanza en Dios¨, esta conformado por 3 integrantes que tienen sus propios negocios y que el día a día, se esfuerzan para poder sacar adelante a sus familias. El líder del grupo es Evertz, de 27 años, dedicado a la comercialización de agroquimicos desde hace 5 años, con ayuda de su suegra empezó este negocio. Ahora el y su esposa quien le ayuda, luchan para sacar adelante a su 5 hijo de añitos. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas y abonos para comercializar en la zona. Las otras integrantes son Maribel, 30 años quien vende productos agroquimicos y Elizabeth de 30 años quien es su hogar tiene una pulperia.
texts.en:
The "Esperanza en Dios" (Faith in God) group is made up of three members wo=ho have their own businesses. Day after day, they work to be able to bring their families up.

The leader of the group is Evertz, 27, who's earned a living selling agrochemicals for the past five years. He started this business with the help of his mother-in-law. Now, he and his wife, who helps him, strive to bring up their five-year-old son.

With the loan, he'll invest in buying fertilizers, insecticides and compost to sell in the region. The other members are Maribel, 30, who sells agrochemicals, and Elizabeth, 30, who has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and compost to sell in the area.

loans.name: Maximo Rene

texts.es:
El mundo de las ventas, el mercadeo, los colores y los mensajes claves, es en el que vive Máximo, un joven de 19 años de edad, que a su corta estudia la carrera de Mercadotecnia y trabaja desde hace seis meses. Este joven con grandes visiones a futuro, si siente más que seguro de lo que está haciendo, pues él considera que hacer lo que le apasiona y mira un futuro prometedor en el buen mercadeo con grandes empresas. 
Máximo es un joven que recibe el apoyo incondicional de sus padres, pues siendo jubilados, ellos le dan todo la ayuda para salir adelante. La sonrisa cautivadora que tiene, asegura lo bien que se siente estudiando esa carrera, por lo que no duda en invertir en sus conocimientos de nuevo. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y para pagar un curso de inglés, de manera que le permitirá en convertirse en un profesional global y obtener las herramientas correctas para crecer profesionalmente. En sus planes está culminar sus estudios con excelentes calificaciones.
texts.en:
Máximo is a 19 year old young man who lives in the world of sales, marketing, colors and key messages. In short, he's studying marketing and has been working for six months. This young man has a big vision for his future and feels more than sure in what he's doing. He believes that doing what you're passionate about and sees a promising future in large companies with good marketing.

Máximo is a young man who receives unconditional support from his parents; being retired, they give him all the help he needs to get ahead. His captivating smile says how good it feels to study this profession, so he does not hesitate to invest in his knowledge again.

For this reason, he's applying for a loan to buy a computer and pay for an English course, so that he will be able to become a global professional and get the right tools to grow professionally. He plans to finish his studies with excellent grades.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay for an English course.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is in Ukay-ukay (used clothing) business for 20 years. She travels to neighboring towns during their market day and display her used clothing. She's making good sales through this business and she had purchase her own truck that she used in transporting her products. Evelyn at 65 years old still has the enthusiasm in making profits in providing her needs as wel as the needs of her children and grandchildren. Recently, she avails a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bulk inventories of used clothing for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bulk inventories of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 56 years old, married with adult age children from Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a rice farmer that is her primary source of income. She has been into this type of business for a longer time even before she got married. Delia had expanded her rice farming and had produced bulk rice grains. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC through the loan program intended to farmers like her. The amount that she loaned shall be used to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Farming has been her life. Esterlita had spent her lifetime into farming. She had mastered the craft in farming from land preparation, seed bed preparation, sowing, replanting, pre-harvest and post-harvest management and operation. She's been doing well with this activities and had generated income enough to send all her children to school until they finished college and landed good jobs.

Despite the fact that she does not need to till her land because she had received support from her children, she still willing to do the same routines in farming because stating and doing nothing for her makes her unproductive citizen. So, just recently, she asks for a loan for farmers like her to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is a loving mother to her adult age children. She is supported by her husband who is  working abroad. Matilde learns about Paglaum MPC and sign up for membership. Her eldest daughter is in college and needs to pay her tuition fee and school fees. She asks from the cooperative for a loan to pay for tuition fee and other school fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and other fees for her daughter at college

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Virgen de Caacupe, es un grupo que se formó en la localidad de Santaní, integrado por 16 señoras todas trabajadoras e independientes, se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres.
Cristina es integrante de este comité, es una señora muy emprendedora, trabaja en una estancia, se desempeña como capataza y recibe un salario mensual. A parte de eso cría animales como chanchos, gallinas,  vacas y vende los productos derivados de ellos, es una mujer muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados, y animales para la cría, como ser gallinas y chanchos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The committee is called Virgen de Caacupe and was formed in the town of Santaní. It is made up of 16 women who are all hard-working and independent and they are in the first cycle of the Women’s Committee Program.

Cristina is a member of this committee and is an enterprising woman. She works on a ranch as an overseer and receives a monthly salary. Besides this she breeds animales such as pigs, hens and cows and she sells their byproducts. She is a tenacious woman and she makes a great effort to be able to help her family and give them everything they need for a respectable life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of animal feed as well as animals to breed, such as hens and pigs. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to better her life.

loans.use: to buy feed and animals to breed, such as hens and pigs.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeño, Luis se vio inspirado por los trabajos comunitarios, pues era del grupo beneficiado de proyectos sociales formativos y de participación activa, fortaleciendo su visión como joven líder, razón suficiente para decidir estudiar la carrera de Trabajo Social, estando ya a punto de finalizar. A sus 23 años de edad, ya trabaja como técnico facilitador, poniendo en práctica sus conocimientos en trabajo social comunitario. 
Afortunadamente Luis cuenta con el apoyo moral y económico de su madre, además de poseer sus propios ingresos que le ayudan a sustentar a su hogar y sus estudios también. Con tanta fuerza él solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de la graduación, su examen de grado y para comprar una computadora, con esta inversión podrá realizar sus trabajos universitarios sin problemas, además de encaminarse correctamente para obtener su título. En sus planes está culminar su carrera para realizar una maestría en Gerencia Social.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Luis was inspired by community works. He was from the group benefitting from formative social projects and active participation, strengthening his vision as a community leader and giving him enough reason to pursue a degree in social work, which he is about to complete.

At 23, he already works as a technical facilitator, putting his knowledge into practice in community social work. Fortunately, Luis has the moral and economic support of his mother. He also has his own income, which helps him sustain his household and his studies as well.

With great strength, he seeks a loan to pay for the costs of graduating, his degree exam and the purchase of a computer. With this investment, he'll be able to finish his university work without problems and be routed correctly for his degree. He plans to finish his degree to complete a master's degree in social management.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of graduating, his degree exam and the purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juanita has a rag making business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy thread, and other materials needed for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy thread, and other materials needed for her rag making business.

loans.name: Leonor Isabel

texts.es: Doña Leonor de 54 años, soltera, con un hijo a su responsabilidad de 17 años, quien cursa actualmente la secundaria. esta por primera vez solicitando crédito a ADIM a los socios de KIVA, para poder financiar su negocio. Desde hace 10 años ella tiene una pulperia y linea de ropa y productos varios para vender. Ahora que requiere agrandarlo invertirá en la compra de sillas abuelitas, ropas y electrodomésticos. Así le ofrecerá mayor variedad a su amada clientela.
texts.en:
Leonor is 54 years old, unmarried, and with a 17-year-old child under her charge who is currently in secondary school.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva's associates ADIM in order to finance her business.

For ten years, she has had a grocery store, a line of clothes and varied products to sell. Now that she needs to make her business bigger, she will invest in buying rocking chairs, clothes, and household appliances. In this manner, she will offer a bigger variety to her beloved customers.

loans.use: to buy rocking chairs, clothes, and household appliances.

loans.name: Elsania

texts.es: Elsania esta por 4ta. vez solicitando crédito para poder agrandar su pulperia ubicada en su hogar. De 45 años, soltera y con un hijo de 9 años, quien se esfuerza para que reciba la educación necesaria para salir adelante, donde actualmente cursa la primaria. Desde hace nueve años tiene esta pulperia, y ahora requiere aumentar su inventario y comprara pollos, embutidos, gaseosas, arroz, aceite, etc. Así tendrá mas surtida la venta y sus clientes estarán satisfecho.
texts.en:
For the fourth time, Elsania is seeking a loan to be able to stock her grocery store located in her home. She's 45, single and has a nine year old son. She works hard for him so he can receive the necessary education to get ahead. Right now, he's in primary school.

She's had this grocery store for nine years and needs to increase her inventory now. She will buy to buy chickens, sausages, soft drinks, rice, oil, etc. As a result, she'll have more stock to sell and her customers will be happy.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sausages, soft drinks, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Amarely De Los Angeles

texts.es: Amarely, de 30 años se dedica a la comercializacion de ropa nueva, desde hace 5 años. Casada y con 2 hijos de edades 12 y 6 años de los cuales actualmente están cursando la primaria y secundaria. Tiene como primordial meta emprender mas, y que su negocio le genere mas ingresos para seguirles brindando grandes oportunidades a su hijos. Por lo que con el dinero lo invertirá en la compra pantalones y camisas de colegio, pantalones jeans. Con las ganancias generadas espera poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Amarely, is 30 years old and has been selling new clothing for five years. She's married with two children who are 12 and six years old and are currently in primary and secondary school.

Her main goal is to take on more and have her business earn more income to be sure of giving her children big opportunities. Because of this, she'll invest the loan in buying high school pants and shirts, and jeans. With the income earned she hopes to be able to continue building her house.

loans.use: to buy high school pants and shirts, and jeans.

loans.name: Busora

texts.ru: Бусора, 43 года, в разводе, мать 3 сыновей и дочери (старшему сыну - 27 лет, самому младшему - 3 года). Дети ее главная ценность в жизни. В настоящее время занимается сельским хозяйством, дети помогают по хозяйству. Бусора с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу, так как ей нужно воспитывать своих детей. Ежегодно обрабатывает 0,3 Га земли, выращивает кукурузу, в саду растут виноград, черешня, абрикосы. Также в хозяйстве есть 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль - 15,600 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 7 ягнят для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Бусоре развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Busora is 43 years old, in the process of becoming divorced, and has three sons and a daughter (the oldest son is 27 the youngest is 3). Her children are of primary importance in her life. She is currently a farmer, and her children help around the property. She takes her work very seriously, as she must support her children. She grows corn annually on .3 hectares of land, and grapes, cherries, and apricots in her garden. She also owns 20 sheep. Her monthly income is 15,600 som (KGS), but that is not enough to support her family suitably. She came to Bai Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy seven lambs for fattening and subsequent resale. Income from the loan will allow Busora to develop her business and improve the family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy 7 lambs for fattening and subsequent resale in order to increase her family income

loans.name: Kundumurimo Cb Group

texts.en: Providance is a group leader, aged 37 years. She is married with four children aged between 11 and 18 years. They all go to school. The group is called KUNDUMURIMO, which means “LOVE TO WORK” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses so they can change their future for the better. Providance sells clothes and has been running a business for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more skirts, trousers and T-shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and go towards medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more skirts, trousers and T-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Muyanda

texts.en:
Muyanda is a 31-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children and lives in Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over two years now with the assistance of her family. She sells soap, cooking oil, salt and sugar to her community.

Muyanda inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. With the requested loan Muyanda intends to increase her stock, improve sales and increase profits. She is also hoping to create employment within her community.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agashya Sub Group A

texts.en: Leoncie is a group leader, aged 30 years. She is married with three children aged between 3 and 14 years. The group is called AGASHYA means “SURPRISE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to change their future for the better. She sells shoes and has been running in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Raykhon

texts.ru: Райхону 34 года. Она веселая и остроумная женщина. Она мать двоих детей. Мужа у нее нет. Райхон одна растет детей. Она дома занимается шитьем. Райхон мечтает открыть собственное ателье. Но сейчас все ее внимание занимает ее дети и их успеваемость в школе. Скоро начнется учебный год и Райхону необходимо собрать детей в школу. Для приобретения учебников и школьной формы уходит много денег и Райхон обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить необходимое для детей. Она надеется, что ее дети получить все необходимое для полноценного образования. Вы сейчас можете сыграть роль в будущее детей Райхона.
texts.en: Raykhon is 34 years old. She is a cheerful and intelligent woman, and the mother of two children. She doesn't have a husband, so she is raising the children alone. She works as a seamstress from home, and dreams of opening her own shop. But right now all her attention is on her children and their success in school. The new school year is beginning soon and Raykhon needs to send the children to school. Buying textbooks and school forms is expensive, so Raykhon is asking for a loan to buy what the children need. She hopes that her children will have what they need to obtain a full education. You can play a role in the future of these children.

loans.use: To buy school books and forms for the children

loans.name: Agashya Sub Group B

texts.en: Josianne is a group leader, aged 31 years. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 10 years; three of them go to school. The group is called AGASHYA which means “SURPRISE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. She has a shop and has been running this business for years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Marivic has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nubia Estela

texts.en:
Nubia is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. She has two sons; they are 11 and 4 years old. This year she decided to start her own business, she runs an arepa (tortilla made of corn popular in Colombia) production business because her and her family were going through a bad path.

She wants to give to her family a good quality of life. She asked for a loan so she can buy cheese, meat, pineapple, jam so she can prepare better arepas that people love.

For Nubia her sons are the most important thing in her life, so she dreams with paying for a good education for them, she also would like to repair her house because it has some problems. You can help Nubia to achieve her goals with a loan.

loans.use: buy cheese, meat, pineapple, jam so she can prepare better arepas that people love.

loans.name: Leonidas Miguel

texts.es:
A veces pensamos que los superhéroes son los que tienen una identidad secreta o que visten con una capa y un traje extravagante, sin embargo, no todos son así, Leonidas, es de esos héroes que le apasiona llevar a cabo la justicia en su país, razón por la cual estudia la licenciatura en Derecho desde hace tres años. A sus 33 años, él no se da por vencido de obtener un título universitario, pues quiere cumplir su meta personas, seguir aportando económicamente en su hogar, ser un excelente esposo y ser un ejemplo a seguir para sus tres hijos de 7,10 y 13 años de edad. 
Afortunadamente, Leonidas tiene su trabajo estable desde hace cuatro años como electricista, sin embargo, él desea ya convertirse en el abogado defensor de las personas. Por esta razón, para él es importante invertir en su educación, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y libros que le facilitaran en sus trabajos universitarios y a seguir nutriendo sus conocimientos. En sus planes está culminar su carrera y poder optar por un trabajo acorde a su licenciatura.
texts.en:
At times we think that superheroes are those who have a secret identity or dress with a cape and extravagant suit, however, not all are like that. Leonidas is one of those heroes who is passionate to bring about justice in his country, which is the reason he has studied law for the last three years. At 33, he isn't giving up on obtaining a university degree. He wants to accomplish his personal goals, to continue providing financially in his home, to be an excellent husband, and to be an example to follow for his three children ages 7, 10, and 13.

Fortunately, Leonidas has had a stable job for four years as an electrician. Nevertheless, he wishes to become a defense lawyer. For this reason, it is important to him to invest in his education, which is why he is seeking a loan to buy a computer and books that will help him in his academic work and continue feeding his knowledge. He plans to finish his degree and apply for a job in accordance with his degree.

loans.use: to buy a computer and books.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is an artisan from Peru who specializes in leather bags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather for his designs.

Arturo has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Arturo has specialized in tooled leather since 1995. His parents are in the clothing industry, where he learned many of the techniques he applies to leather. The father of two children, Arturo gets many design ideas from his wife, Veronica. "I prefer desk accessories, handbags, briefcases and luggage. We use hand tools and I've formed a community of artisans who collaborate with me. Our designs are lovingly crafted by hand, and we feel a personal attachment to what we do," he says.

"I'd like to send my thanks in advance for your wonderful support. With this microcredit, we will be able to acquire a solid quantity of raw material at a good price. This will prevent us from losing out on any sales due to lack of inventory."

Use the link below to view Arturo's leather bags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3957

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather for his designs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 32-year-old married man applying for a loan of 1,000,000/=. He has three children who are school-going. Godfrey does stay in a rented single room in the outskirts of the city. He owns a Bajaj motorcycle which he uses to transport travelers who pay him depending on the distance covered. From his meagre daily income, he has always managed to educate his children, feed and take care of his family.

His main challenge is seeing his family occupy a single room. He does own a piece of land which he inherited from his father. He applied for the loan to purchase doors, iron sheets and windows for the double-room house that he wants to put up. He already bought sand, cement and bricks.
His future hope is owning a house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Anela

texts.en:
A $ 1500.00 is offered to Anela to improve her business.She is married to a farmer and she has five children and she runs a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles,sugar, salt, milk, water, slippers, fish, candles and biscuits.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Anela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, salt, milk, water, slippers, fish, candles and biscuits.

loans.name: Netsai

texts.en: Netsai is a 28-year-old mother of two from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Netsai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her community, teaching leadership skills to secondary students. When she is not teaching young students, Netsai has been supporting her family with her grocery business for the past year. Also, she has diversified to a poultry rearing project that she intends to intensify with the loan that she is requesting from KIVA. This would increase her profit margin and this would enable her to further improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal EL AMANECER, él socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de huevos de codorniz y venta de pantalones, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de pantalones entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank El Amanecer (Dawn). He continues earning a living selling quail eggs and pants. 

He feels grateful for the loan provided and promises to comply with the established payments. He is a responsible and tenacious person, which is how he brings up his family. 

The members seeks a loan to buy pants, among other things.

loans.use: to buy pants, among other things.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 29 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for 5 years. Thanh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
With her business profit, Thanh hopes to build a new house, to make enough money to provide for her kids and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Ruflan

texts.en: Ruflan is single, 39 years old from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He has a hog fattening business that primarily supports his needs. He hopes to finish the construction of his house especially the kitchen area and the toilet. He asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional hollow blocks, bags of cements, plywood and sticks.

loans.use: to purchase additional hollow blocks, bags of cement, plywood and sticks for the condstruction of a toilet

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula has been running her convenience store for almost 30 years. She started from a small store with an initial capital of PHP 650.00 that she had in her pocket after her wedding. She invested that little amount into buying consumable goods that is commonly used in a simple household and rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she had expanded her little business and add on more products such as liquor, deodorants, over the counter medicines, and even rice and corn grains for human consumption and now she also sells animal feeds.

Teodula recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business had come true. However, she said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a longer time. She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs that she asks for a loan of PHP 40,000.00 to restock store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.use: to restock store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en: Yet’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Yet makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 50 years old, married and mother of four adult-aged children who lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is in the business of raising hogs and runs this business venture with financial support from Paglaum MPC. She is seeking a loan from the cooperative to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 40 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $ 800.00. she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as sugar, salt, milk, water, Cocacola, Sagiko ,Sprite, biscuits, soap, slippers, coffee and sugar. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy ,sugar, salt, milk, water, Cocacola, Sagiko, Sprite, biscuits, soap, slippers, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 56 years old with four children, all of whom are grown up and have their own families.

Leonora has operated her sari-sari store ever since her children were much younger and her husband works as a driver. Since her husband's income is not enough to support their expenses, her store helps with making their ends meet. Now that her children are grown up, Leonora is still operating her store to help support her daily expenses. She does not want to depend on her children for support and wants to take care of her own.

Leonora's store is patronized by the people in their community because it's located in front of the street. But most of Leonora's challenge is having a lack of capital to supply her customers' demands, especially with basic items like rice. She wanted to purchase rice to be able to sell to her customers to increase her income.

Leonora is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy three sacks of rice, two boxes of noodles, two boxes of canned goods, two boxes of laundry soap and bars, and other additional items to sell to her store.

With the loan Leonora is hopeful that she will be able to increase her income as she will now be able to supply the demands of her customers.

Leonora wants to continuously manage her store as it is now her only source of income. Leonora also wants to save for her family's health and also for unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice, two boxes of noodles, two boxes of canned goods, two boxes of laundry soap and bars, and other additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Lo que hace siete años era una casa da plástico, ahora es un hogar de concreto, con una excelente infraestructura y una pulpería estable de gran alcance. Este es el fruto de varios años de trabajo de Williams, un emprendedor de 33 años de edad que tan solo terminó la primaria, pero que se ha visionado como un gran empresario, que no tarda mucho en lograrlo. La perseverancia, el ahorro y la pasión por salir adelante le han ayudado a que este comerciante además de tener su pulpería, también haya conseguido construir dos casas más para alquilarlas y así tener otros ingresos.
Williams es de esas personas inspiradoras, que al escuchar sus historias hacen que la gente se sienta motivada para emprender ellos también. Además su insistencia por seguir creciendo no lo hacen dudar en seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, avena, meneítos, leche, pan, entre otros productos, que al comprarlos por mayor le permiten ofrecer a sus clientes precios muchos más accesibles y que él haga crecer sus ventas. En sus planes está seguir mejorando su hogar y los que alquila.
texts.en:
What was seven years ago a house made of plastic, is now a concrete home with excellent infrastructure and a stable far-reaching store. This is the fruit of a number of years of work by Williams. He is a 33 year old entrepreneur who only completed primary school but had the vision of a great businessman and it didn't take long to become one. Perseverance, his savings and a passion for getting ahead have helped this merchant, who besides having his store has also managed to build two other to rent and thus have other revenues.

Williams is one of those inspiring people who on hearing their story makes people motivated to start themselves. Plus his insistence to continue growing leaves him no doubt about continuing to invest in his store. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oats, chips, milk, and bread amongst other products. Buying them wholesale allows him to offer his clients much more accessible prices which will increase his sales. Amongst his plans is to continue making improvements on his house and the rental houses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oats, chips, milk, and bread amongst other products.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a la pobreza de sus padres no pudo continuar la escuela, está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos, los cuales viven con ellos.

Maritza, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde para vender desde hace tres años, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar con este negocio en donde le apoya su esposo, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique y la granja la tiene en las afueras de la casa. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 100 pollos para ampliar la granja; los pollos los compra de 2 días de nacidos y luego los cuida y les da concentrado para que se engorden para luego venderlos.

Los sueños de Maritza son que su pequeña granja vaya creciendo y pueda ir generando los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old. She went to school until the 6th grade but due to her parent's poverty, she could not continue going to school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have two children who live with them. Maritza has had a farm for selling broiler chickens for three years. Need led her to start this business with the help of her husband. She does not have another job and the farm is on the outskirts of the house.

She needs the loan to buy 100 chickens to increase the farm. She buys the chickens 2 days after they're born. She takes care of and gives food to them to fatten them and then sell. Maritza's dreams are that her small farm keeps growing and that she can get the necessary funds to cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens to increase the farm.

loans.name: Saram's Group

texts.en: Saram’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Saram makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as factory laborer and soldier to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. For the past two years, Rose has owned and operated a small general store. She sells a variety of food items, such as rice, noodles, biscuits, sugar, and canned foods. 

Rose joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy goods to restock her store. She plans to use her profits to help covers her family's daily expenses and provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, noodles, biscuits, cooking oil, and canned food for her general store

loans.name: Ledya

texts.es:
Ledya continúa con su negocio de venta de alfombras. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina de coser industrial. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Su negocio continúa mejorando, actualmente realiza gorros para niños en todo color y variedad de tejidos, “la máquina que compramos nos inició en este nuevo campo de la confección de ropa…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que sus productos se venden continuamente, la desventaja es la faltad e capital para la compra de telas y tejidos por mayor para confeccionar gorros de niño. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de tela, tejidos, hilos y material de confección para confeccionar gorros de niño. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a este rubro.
Es por esos motivos que Ledya solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela, tejidos, hilos y material de confección para confeccionar gorros de niño.
texts.en:
Ledya continues with her business selling rugs. The loan that she received was used to buy an industrial sewing machine. Her loan payments were punctual. Her business keeps improving and now she makes children's hats in all different colors and fabrics. "The machine that we bought started us in this new dressmaking field," she says.

The advantage of her business is that her products are continuously sold. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy the fabrics and yarn at wholesale price to make children's hats.

Her dream is to stabilize her business. She wants to buy fabric, yarn, thread and manufacturing materials to make children's hats. This is the 2nd loan with the institution in the first year that she has been doing this work. For these reasons, Ledya is asking for a loan to buy fabric, yarn, thread and manufacturing materials to make children's hats.

loans.use: to buy fabric, yarn, thread and manufacturing materials to make children's hats.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: Samath’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mey's Group

texts.en: Mey’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Mey makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel for boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate metal, wood, and nails to improve the roof of the kitchen where she also has her tortilla business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal EL AMANECER, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de huevos de codorniz, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia  solicito el crédito para la compra de huevos de codorniz.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "El Amanecer" loan group. She continues working in her business selling quail eggs. She feels thankful for the loan she received and promises to make her repayments. She is a responsible person and wants to keep working in order to support her family. She is asking for the loan to buy quail eggs.

loans.use: to buy quail eggs.
