loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El socio Virgilio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien se dedica al negocio de agricultura,el socio es una persona trabajadoar que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es comprarse mas ganados. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Virgilio continues working in his cattle business and also has a business in agriculture. He is a hard-working person who wants to support his family with this business. His dream is to buy more cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle. He feels happy for the loan and promises to carry out his fee payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 37 years old, married and the mother of one child. To earn a living and help her husband provide for their family, she needs to farm. Her husband is a Photoshop editor, and helps by planting crops and selling them in the local market. Because of the increasing price of supplies these days, she decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plot so she can produce a good-quality crop. Irene’s plan for the future is to earn more profits to pay for family needs and the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.name: Eduar Mauricio

texts.es: Eduar es un emprendedor hombre de 35 años de edad que durante sus años de adolescencia aprendió de su padre el oficio en el que se desempeña; su día a día inicia en su taller de mecánica entre motores de camiones, tractores y todo tipo de vehículos pesados a los que repara y ofrece servicio de mantenimientos preventivos, también fabrica carrocerías.  Eduar cuenta con siete años de experiencia en su taller ubicado en el municipio de Chocontá en el Departamento de Cundinamarca, sus clientes llegan hasta su taller para realizar cotizaciones y una vez acordado todos los detalles se realiza el contrato.  Sus compras las realiza de contado a almacenes en Bogotá y con la finalidad de tener un stock de componentes y repuestos necesarios para sus trabajos, está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en ésta propuesta y su negocio mejorará pues aumentará su productividad. Su meta a futuro es adecuar con todo lo necesario para tener un taller que ofrezca servicios calificados y en lo personal ofrecer buenos estudios a su hija y construir un apartamento.
texts.en: Eduar is a 35 year old enterprising man who during his teenage years learned the work he currently performs from his father. His day begins in his mechanic shop amid truck motors, tractors, and all kinds of heavy vehicles in need of repair. He also offers preventative maintenance and does auto body repair. Eduar has 7 years of experience in his shop, which is located in Chocontá, Cundinamarca department. His customers arrive to his shop to make repairs and upon agreeing on the details, work is put into a contract. He makes his purchases at stores in Bogota. With the goal of stocking his shop with components and parts needed for his work, he is seeking his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with the end goal of increasing his productivity. His goal for the future is to have everything he needs in his shop in order to offer qualified services and personally, to be able to send his daughter to school and build an apartment.

loans.use: to buy a supply of components and parts.

loans.name: Somoun's Group

texts.en: The members of Somoun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. To support her family, Somoun cultivates rice and works at a factory. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Somoun and the other women safeguard their families' health. Additionally, it will help them save money on medical expenses and time otherwise used to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de bebé.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por sus paisajes verdes y calor intenso. 
Liliana es morena, de cabello corto, usa lentes de aumento. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de bebé como; pantalones, poleras, baberos, vestidos, conjuntos y otros “la ropa de bebé es el gusto que se dan los padres para ver a sus bebes lindos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería. Su sueño es vender en la feria ‘EXPOCRUZ’, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de bebe para cubrir la demanda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Liliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa de bebe para ofertar mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Liliana is 41 years old, lives with her husband, has a 15 year old son, and her business is selling baby clothing. She is enterprising, decisive, and very responsible. She is a street vendor in the southern zone of her city, known for its green landscape and intense heat.

Liliana has a dark complexion, short hair, and wears glasses. Her first language is Guarani and she also speaks Spanish. Her husband works as a driver and her son studies in school. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a laminate roof.

Her business is selling baby clothes such as pants, sweaters, bibs, dresses, outfits, and other items. "Baby clothing gives the parents pleasure to see their baby dressed beautifully..." she states.

The advantage for her business is that she has continuous sales; the challenge is the lack of capital in order to buy merchandise. Her dream is to sell in the Expocruz market.

She wishes to buy baby clothing in order to meet customer demand. This is the first sequence of loans from the institution in 3 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Liliana seeks a loan to buy a variety of baby clothing in order to offer a greater variety of product.

loans.use: to buy a variety of baby clothing in order to offer a large quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Adrian es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, ubicado en el Caserio patacon - Pomahauca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizara en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Adrian is 31 years old. He lives in his own rustic home with his partner and two young children in the Pomahuaca district, in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, on the northern highlands of Peru.

Adrian makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing rice. He is located in Caserio Patacon - Pomahuaca, and has 8 years of experience in his field. The loan he is seeking will be used in agricultural jobs, applications and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers and to pay labor for his crops. This way, he will help the physiological, morphological and productive improvement of his crops. He will also have a prosperous crop, and thus better production and a better-quality product. He will not have problems selling his product.

loans.use: to buy plant protection products, fertilizers and to pay labor for his crops.

loans.name: Somoun's Group

texts.en: The members of Somoun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. To support her family, Somoun cultivates rice and works as a factory laborer and teacher. In Somoun's village, there is no reliable access to safe and clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the group members safeguard their families' health. Additionally, they will save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es:
Adelfa continúa con su negocio de confección de sábanas. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina de coser recta y tela para trabajar. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas en su negocio. Actualmente su producción mejoró en calidad y cantidad logrando llenar las expectativas económicas, “con esta nueva herramienta hemos mejorado el negocio, pero seguimos trabajando duro…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela por mayor para confeccionar sabanas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adelfa solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor para confeccionar sabanas.
texts.en:
Adelfa continues with her business making blankets. The loan she received was invested into buying an upright sewing machine and fabric to work. Her repayments were punctual because she did not have any problems with her business.

Now, her production has improved in quality and quantity, managing to meet economic expectations. "With this new tool, we have improved the business, but we continue working hard," she says.

The advantage of her business it that her sales are constant. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cuts of fabric at wholesale price. Her dream is to have a permanent place to sell. She wants to buy cuts of fabric to make blankets.

This is the 2nd loan she has asked for in 4 years of doing this job. For those reasons, Adelfa is asking for a loan to buy cuts of fabric to make blankets.

loans.use: to buy cuts of fabric to make blankets.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es: Olga de 46 años habita en compañía de su familia en el municipio de Cogua en el Departamento de Cundinamarca, ella es una microempresaria que encontró la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio,  debido a que sus hijos estudiaban en un municipio aledaño a su lugar de residencia, al igual muchos niños de la localidad estaban en la misma situación y necesitaban de un transporte,  entonces Olga ubicó un microbús y empezó a ofrecer el servicio de transporte escolar. En la actualidad cuenta con ocho años de experiencia transportando niños y conocidos en la ruta de  Cogua y Zipaquirá, a quienes durante todo el año les ofrece el servicio a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.  Olga ha tenido éxito en su negocio por su esfuerzo y dedicación, ella está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en mantenimiento y reparaciones del microbús escolar.  Esta inversión permitirá continuar ofreciendo un servicio seguro y de calidad.  Su meta a futuro es comprar otro vehículo y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olga is 46 years old. She lives with her family in the town of Cogua in the department of Cundinamarca. She is a small business owner who found the opportunity to begin her own business because her children were going to school in a nearby town. Many children in the area were in the same situation and needed transport, so Olga found a bus and began to offer school transportation.

Now she has eight years of experience transporting children and acquaintances on the route from Cogua to Zipaquirá. Year round, she offers her service from 5 AM to 3 PM. She has had success in her business for her effort and dedication.

She is asking for her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in the maintenance and reparations of the school bus. This inversion will allow her to continue offering her safe, quality service. Her future goal is to buy another vehicle and finish building her house.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance and reparations of the school bus.

loans.name: Rolando Francisco

texts.es:
Dicen que la educación y el aprendizaje no tienen fecha de expiración, pues cabe destacar que Rolando es uno de esos hombres que no dejó ir su sueño de convertirse en licenciado en Contaduría pública y finanzas, pues a sus 46 años de edad, tras haber estudiado una carrera técnica de contador y trabajar pro veinte años en esta misma línea, está a punto de convertirse oficialmente en licenciado.
Rolando ya lleva el quinto año de la carrera y sin dejar a un lado su trabajo como contador, ni mucho menos a su esposa y tres hijos, de los cuales está a cargo. Su pasión por el área de finanzas y perseverancia, lo han llevado hasta donde está, razón por la que a estas alturas solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y los tramites de este mismo, con esto logrará convertirse en un contador público autorizado. En sus metas está seguir nutriendo sus conocimientos y realizar dos posgrados y una maestría.
texts.en: It is said that education and learning have no expiry date, and it must be emphasized that Rolando is the kind of man who never let go of his dream of obtaining his degree in accounting and finance. At 46 years of age, after having studied to be an accounting technician and worked in this field for twenty years, he is about to officially become a graduate. Roland is in the fifth year of his degree studies, without putting aside his accounting work or his wife and three dependent children. His passion for the field of finance and his perseverance have taken him to the point where he is requesting a loan to pay the fees to complete his degree and become a certified public accountant. One of his goals is to continue strengthening his knowledge and taking two post-graduate courses and a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay the fees to complete his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, lace, and other products needed to make his products.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 51 year old mother with 9 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has this experience for more than 3 years. Malia requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2002.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyala Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
The lady on the right hand of the group photo in a red blouse is named Salome, who is an old client of Ugafode. She has applied for a loan of ug800.000=. Through Bwanda bakyara kwetugura group which is located at Bwanda village. The 51 years old woman is married and blessed with 06 children.

She operates a grocery shop as her major source of income, which she uses to cater for her entire family financial obligation. Still she also operates a restaurant as additional source of income, However she found out that her business alone could not meet all her financial needs especially school fees for grand children.

Therefore she joined UGAFODE to access financial assistance to expand her business and meet the demands of her clients by acquiring a loan to buy more business stock including, yellow bananas, greens, fruits of any kind and she is hopeful that her dreams will come true and her businesses will improve gradually. The whole group thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled them to educate their children, sustain their business and earn a living.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade business

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rose Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell chicken meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Rose Marie is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy dressed chicken to sell to her local market.

Rose Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken to sell to her local market

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 46 years old with 2 children ages 8 and 4 years old.

Her husband is helping her in operating their cellphone accessories business. Its their only source of income and helps support with their daily needs and with the school expenses of their children.
Though both hardworking, the income is not enough for the rental space, education and their daily needs so they add other items like sunglasses, shoes to increase their income and maximize the space they have in their store. The store that is located near the street which is a good opportunity for sales.

Bernadette now is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 20,000 to buy cellphone accessories, and other apparel like shoes, sunglasses, wallets to sell to her store.

The loan will enable her to expand and add other items to sell to her store to continuously generate an income when the other products are not making sales. Bernadette wanted add to more items like clothes to her store someday to increase her income and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy for cellphone accessories, and other apparel like shoes, sunglasses, wallets to sell to her store.

loans.name: Benjamin Aristides

texts.es:
Benjamin, de 55 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y tienen 3 hijos, pero ya no viven con él porque todos son mayores y tiene sus propias familias.

Benjamin, se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente siembra maíz, frijol y arroz, pero también siembran hortalizas como pipianes y tomates.

Benjamin, necesita el crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y berbicidas para sus cultivos. 

El deseo de Benjamin, es seguir trabajando para tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 55 years old, married, lives with his wife and has three children. The children don't live with him as they are grown and have their own families.

Benjamin farms. He grows corn, beans, and rice, and also plants crops such as tomatoes and chilis. Benjamin needs a loan to buy farming supplies such as manure, pesticides, and herbicides for his crops.

Benjamin wishes to continue working in order to have a tranquil old age.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure, pesticides, and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Grupo Trabajadores De Chuitzanchaj Group

texts.es: Jose es un gran hombre de 26 años de edad, casado con una linda familia, él  cuenta que gracias al apoyo del crédito logro comprar sus insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de café y a Dios gracias logro una buena cosecha y logro venderlos a un buen precio en su mercado regional, con este logro Jose está lleno de buena actitud para seguir mejorando sus ingresos, por tal motivo nuevamente solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café. El mayor anhelo de Jose es obtener una buena ganancia con esta cosecha para finalizar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Jose is a great 26 year old man who is married and has a beautiful family. He states that thanks to the support of the loan, he succeeded in purchasing his agricultural supplies for his coffee crops and thanks to God, he achieved a good harvest and sold his crops at a good price at his regional market.

Due to this success, Jose is full of a good attitude to continue improving his income. For this reason, he is once again requesting a loan that he will use to buy fertilizers and maintain his coffee crops. Jose's greatest wish is to obtain a good profit with this harvest in order to finalize the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise has more than 20 years of accounting experience; she began her career working as a staff accountant for a tech firm, when she decided she wanted to attend cosmetology school.

Through her time in cosmetology school, Denise learned about hair products and hair care and then began purchasing hair extensions for herself. When she was purchasing, she realized that many people were not knowledgeable about the quality of the hair they were using and purchasing, including salon owners.

Denise decided to established Evinn’s Beauty and Hair Supply in July 2015. When Denise heard about the Accion Academy for Entrepreneurial Success, she decided it would be a good time to officially launch her business.

With her cosmetology experience, and her ability to travel to the various countries to ensure high-quality hair purchases, Denise has an advantage in the industry. She has decided to work as a consultant to educate people in the industry in the various types of hair and quality.

Denise will use the Kiva loan to purchase a variety of hair extensions to build up her inventory.

Denise will remain the only employee until the business grows enough to necessitate an additional sales associate. She dreams of one day owning her own salon where her clients could come to purchase hair and receive various beauty treatments.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of hair extensions inventory.

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en:
Awudu is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks and decor. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish.

Awudu has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:
"When I was a boy, I'd follow my friends home after school. Their parents had a carving workshop. They noticed my interest and let me try sandpapering the carved items, then I began learning how to design and finish a piece. I had to drop out of school due to financial difficulties and I started working on my own. I was determined to make it and was able to put my siblings through school. Now my dream is to further my education and expand my workshop to be able to train more people."

"Without your help, we could not get money for the materials we need to craft more pieces for the upcoming holiday season. Thank you very much in the name of Allah."

Use the link below to view Awudu's hand-carved African masks and decor on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7784

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!  We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Taufik.  He lives in Rembang, which is a region in the northeastern part of Central Java. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as give more contributions to his community. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he understands more about how to manage his business. 

As the business grows, Taufik needs additional capital is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his village community. Taufik's goal in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for other communities (Ruma's latest product called 'Mapan).  Later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Taufik is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Mariée,  Félicienne est  âgée de 42 ans et mère de deux enfants. Félicienne vie à Tokoin pour préparer et vendre des amuses gueules. Félicienne s’approvisionne chez un grossiste dans une boutique de son quartier. Félicienne sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de blés, un bidon d’huile et les autres produits pour la  préparation. Ce crédit lui permettra  d’avoir une plus grande quantité,  ce qui lui permet de réaliser plus de revenu et mieux contribuer beaucoup aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Félicienne is a 42-year-old married mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin, where she makes and sells snacks. Félicienne gets her supplies from a wholesaler's store in her local area. Félicienne is requesting this loan so she can purchase sacks of wheat, one container of oil and the other materials needed to make these snacks. This loan will allow her to create larger quantities of her goods, which will allow her to earn a bigger income and better contribute towards her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of wheat, one container of oil, one pack of peak powdered milk and one sack of wood charcoal

loans.name: Tuaialuga

texts.en: Tuaialuga is a 28 year old mother with 3 children. She runs business of cooking rice and curry and sell them in her community to earn a living. Tuaialuga requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, sack of onions, plastics bags, container, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to build a small restaurant in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, sack of onions, plastics bags, container,

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee un molino de nixtamal, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y cambiando el techo, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda diga.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelated because he is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has a corn mill. With what he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by plastering the walls and changing the roof, but what he earns from his job is not enough to do it. He is applying for a loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labor so that he can have a decent house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Smile And Shine - N11Lthànhđhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi is 53 years old and is married. She lives in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. For the last seven years, she has been operating a butcher shop.  

Mrs Lợi is considered a member of a low-income household. Moreover, her income is unstable because it fluctuates based on the meat quality. If there is a swine disease breakout, then people demand less meat and her business suffers.  However, the main hardship that Mrs. Lợi faces is lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more good-quality meat to resell. Mrs. Lợi hopes for ensure that her family is healthy and happy. She also wants to travel domestically and maintain a successful business.

In 2013, Mrs. Lợi joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mrs. Lợi has successfully repaid three loans with them. She is also the group leader of "Smile and shine - N11LThànhĐHải", which consists of six members.

loans.use: to purchase quality meat to resell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Wilma is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business like wood, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture making business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like wood, nails, varnish and other materials

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shiela Mae is 28 years old and has two children are still in school.

Shiela Mae has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Shiela Mae requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her stall.

Shiela Mae has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз, 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 сыновей, старший сын- студент, младшие - школьники. У Кундуз среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Кундуз на сегодняшний день имеет 5 коров. На 0,40 Га земли она выращивает клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Кундуз в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для завершения строительства дома, как следствие - улучшение жилищных условий семьи. Свои доходы Кундуз планирует вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Kunduz is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three sons. Her eldest son is a student, and her youngest is at school. Kunduz has a secondary education, and earns an additional income for her family by working in animal husbandry and crop cultivation, having started 18 years ago. Thanks to her tireless hard work, today Kunduz has five cows. She grows clover for sale and for personal consumption on 0.40 hectares of land. In order to further expand her business, Kunduz turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials to finish building her house and consequently, to improve her family's living conditions. With her income, Kunduz plans to invest in the development of her business and the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 44-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good and she has to think a long time about starting any task. Now her son has just begun to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads, and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused it to break down. Now the rickshaw's body needs to be replaced because it rattles when being driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new moto rickshaw.

Nargis has requested a loan for her son so he can buy new moto rickshaw's body and can drive it smoothly.

NARGIS thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of a kid.

She owns a beauty parlor in partnership with an expert in hair styling and cutting. She is an expert in makeup. Both are very professional in their art. She provides makeup to her clients at home, also. Most of their clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her craft. Over time, the furniture has broken and her beauty products are running out. Now, she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new plastic furniture and additional cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc.

She wants to establish a separate parlor in nearby town so she won't have to split her profits.

Fouzia thanks Kiva and field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new plastic furniture and additional cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color and lotion for her parlor.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a successful young business lady who sells clothes at a mall at a flea market in her local community. This business has made her and her family develop and has also made her become a role model to the other young women in her community. 

Using the proceeds from this clothing business, Tsitsi has been managing to pay school fees for her children and meet the financial needs of her family. She has also managed to diversify to a poultry rearing business, which she intends to expand with the repeat loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This would enable her to create employment also for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks to rear and sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a courageous and hard-working young man married with one child, who, little-by-little, has gotten ahead. He has a business selling various products in his small grocery store. 

This is the second loan that he is asking for, and this time it is to buy more items that he will sell to meet the demand of his customers. This will help him to get better sales and more earnings, especially during this back-to-school season. 

His biggest dream is to expand the shop into a wholesale shop, where he will have a variety of items for his customers. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: To boost the retail stock sales by buying more stock

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
This wonderful woman is Saodat. She is 31 years old, married and a mother of four children. Saodat is resident of the beautiful district of Gissar. Saodat is a hardworking woman. With the help of her husband they built a shop. They has purchased children`s clothes, but unfortunately they did not have enough funds to buy shoes for adults to start a business, which she now wants to do.

Saodat has a high hope that with your support she will be able to start a new business and improve her family`s life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and start her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a frozen food retail in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Ana dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old woman with a family of five. She is involved in charcoal trade in town. Alongside that, she does agriculture such as maize growing.

Mariam has applied for a loan to pay for school fees to take her kids back to school. Her biggest problem is price fluctuations and changes that usually lead to losses. She is hardworking and honest. She appreciates the Ugafode and Kiva partnership and the mission of alleviating poverty.

loans.use: to pay tuiton for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a portable solar solution for her small business unit and to increase her productive hours and income.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is a 38-year-old widow and mother with two children, living in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She works for an NGO, has been worked as a staff since 2004. One of her children attend school and other is a factory worker. Together, they can earn about USD 8 per day.

Now she would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to open a small grocery store at home, and save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida has 3 adult age children and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is in coconut buying for copra production (coconut meat for oil production) business. She's making good income from it that she is able to buy cocolands and start the construction of her house. To make it possible, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of cement and pay labor cost for house completion.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and pay labor cost for house completion

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 37 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Merlita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Dedenia

texts.en:
Dedenia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dedenia is 53 years old now.

Dedenia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Dedenia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Dedenia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Dedenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flor is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Flor has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Flor requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Flor has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Flor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Martha Evelyn

texts.es:
Martha, de 45 años de edad, es muy conocida en su comunidad, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Martha, es ama de casa, pero también tiene una tienda en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de golosinas y artículos de primera necesidad. 

Martha, necesita el crédito para comprar más mercancía para su tienda como: golosinas, gaseosas, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, entre otros. 

Martha, desea tener una vida más tranquila y ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She is well known in her community. She is in a relationship and has two
children. Her partner works in agriculture, and helps her with the household expenses.

Martha is a homemaker, but she also operates a store in her home, where she sells all kinds of snacks and staples.

She hopes to have a more settled life, and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store such as snacks, soft drinks, beans, rice, and sugar among other things.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly is a 48-year-old mother of three children. She is a rice farmer for three years, living in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband also work as a construction workers fora fee to earn the additional source of her family’s income, they are able to save around 5 USD each day after offsetting expense. Recently, her rice did not grown well, which affected her income.

Due to lack of working capital, she is now leading a group which consists of three members to apply for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to buy enough household supply for her family’s uses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield to earn more income and ability to buy enough household supply for her family’s uses.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Elisete

texts.en:
Elisete is a woman who is very interested in business; she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible for the household. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as tea, biscuits, noodles, water, cigarettes, candies, detergents, nuts, pop, water bottles and other items to sell.

Since Elisete lives near many people, she has plans to open a bigger business for everybody and wants to stock the items that people like. Elisete first opened her business in 2014 with a capital base of $500.

loans.use: to buy tea, biscuits, noodles, water, cigarettes, candies, detergents, nuts, pop, water bottles and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mellisa

texts.en:
Mellisa is a 21-year-old business lady, now living in Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She used to live in Mt Darwin where she has a grocery shop at the local business center. She started small but this time the business has grown big, so that she has even diverted to poultry rearing. The poultry business is being run in Guruve.

Mellisa inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. She started this poultry rearing project using the proceeds from her shop and she intends to expand it using the loan that she is requesting from Kivs. She ventured into this diversification because she wanted to expand her sources of income. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a 26-year-old married woman with one child. She lives outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. For the past two years, Shirley has owned and operated a small general store, selling a variety of food items.

Shirley needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, biscuits and canned food to assist her in the business. She plans to use her profits to improve her general store and to help cover her family's weekly expenses. Shirley joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned food, biscuits and noodles for her general store.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en: Sern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Leuaea

texts.en: Leuaea is a 42 year old mother with 1 child, she runs a small business of selling ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Leuaea requested for a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, freezer, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, freezer,

loans.name: Phama

texts.en:
Phama is a 32-year-old married father with a dependent child in his care. He resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Phama's main source of income comes from rice farming and he is also a construction worker in his free time. Phama has been farming for over 10 years. His wife is a 35-year-old factory worker. The family earns about $14 / day.

Phama would like to improve his family’s finances, so he needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, he will be able to have enough money to buy the cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Phama is going to save money to buy more cows, build a bigger house and support his child to complete high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUJERES VALIENTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evangelina ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m.la socia es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes," or "Valient Women." This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

This member, Evangelina, is 40 years old, unmarried and has one son. She works in her craftwork business. She sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets, and looms. She sells different fabrics and works from 8am to 7pm. She is a an enterprising and hard-working individual that, by means of this business, wants to help her family get ahead. She has been working for 8 years in this business and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of selling fabrics and looms. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms.

The other partners are in the businesses of selling candy, clothes, groceries, and books.

Evangelina thanks those who form part of this dream using this method, and she promises to fulfill her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée, Abla est une femme  âgée de 45 ans. Abla habite à Agoè où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée sucrée appelé « Abolo ». Abla s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir son mari dans les besoins du foyer et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en: A married woman, Abla is 45 years old and lives in Agoè, where she makes and sells a sweetened cornmeal cake called “abolo”. She gets her supplies of ingredients for making it twice a month at the market. Abla is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn in order to earn more profit with the aim of supporting her husband in meeting household needs and improving her everyday living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional items such as face powder, roll-on deodorant, perfume, etc. for her business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as face powder, roll-on deodorant, perfume, etc. to sell

loans.name: Massogblin

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 46 ans, Massogblin vit à Agoè et a trois enfants à charge. Massogblin se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons frit  pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Massogblin fait recourt à ce crédit pour commander des paniers de poissons en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: A widow and 46 years old, Massogblin lives in Agoè and has three children to support. Her struggles are great in her business selling fried fish for meeting her own needs and those of her children. She has turned to this loan to put in an order for baskets of fish with the aim of having a significant inventory and maximizing her profit, so as to help out her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 baskets of fish

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: Mariée, Djifa a à sa charge trois enfants. Djifa  est âgée de 35 ans et habite à Agoè où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelé « Kom ». Djifa  achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier et à domicile. Djifa  sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs et des condiments en vue de gagner plus de bénéfices et pouvoir soutenir les besoins de sa famille  puis améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en: A married woman, Djifa has three children to support. She is 35 years old and lives in Agoè, where she makes and sells a cornmeal cake called “kom”. She purchases her supplies of ingredients for making it twice a month at the market, and she sells her product at home and from one neighborhood to another. Djifa is requesting this loan to order a sack of corn and some condiments with the aim earning more profit, supporting her husband in meeting family needs, and then improving her everyday living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and 2 tubs of condiments

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena lives in Liquisa. She has been involved in business activities since 2003. She started with her own working capital of USD 500. She is making pounds.

So she is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she takes this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials, such as wheat, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other materials to use.

She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda, 26 years old, is married and has no children. She lives outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. For the past year, Hilda has operated a small convenience store, selling a variety of food items.

Hilda has requested a loan to buy food items such as rice, noodles, biscuits, canned food and soft drinks for her general store. She hopes to use the profits she makes to build a big permanent home for her family and to help cover her family's weekly expenses. Hilda joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, biscuits, canned food and soft drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a woman of 35 years with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Ruta requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, chemicals, to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business.She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, chemicals,

loans.name: Tám

texts.en:
Mrs Tam is 33 years old and she is married. She has operated a stall selling fish for six years. Tam lives in Quang Xuong district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters such as bad storms because it is near the sea.

In 2012, Tam joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tam has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Tam is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tam hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de venta de gaseosas, refrescos, aguas, etc. ubicado en el mercado municipal tiene 4 años de tener su negocio y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his family group.

He has a business selling soft drinks, juices, water, etc. located in the municipal market.  He has operated this business for four years now.  With what he obtains from his income he is able to absolve some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more products wholesale and so to continue with his sales and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase soda, juices, water, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 34 years old, single, and living with his parents. He owns a vegetable store and manages a videoke because he wants to help his parents with their living and also increase their family income for their daily needs. That's why he is in the food-vending business.

Roel has decided to borrow another loan to purchase fertilizer for his vegetables and fruit in order to produce a good quality of product and to be able to provide for the needs of his customers.

In the future, Roel wants to have his own family someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his vegetables.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jovelyn has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell.

Jovelyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Essi est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans habitant à Agoè. Essi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Essi s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois ; ce qui lui permettra d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: The mother of four children, Essi is married, 43 years old, and living in Agoè. She is a retailer of charcoal and works actively to earn a living with the aim of supporting herself. She gets her supplies at the market four times a month and is asking for this loan to put in an order for sacks of charcoal, which will enable her to have more income and cope with family expenses, as well as to prepare her children for the start of this school year.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, de 66 años de edad, es agricultor, no tiene ningún grado académico, debido a la gran pobreza que vivió junto a sus padres no continuo estudiando; está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, junto a ella procreó ocho hijos, todos son mayores de edad y están casados.

Para José, no fue nada fácil darle a sus hijos una vida digna, debido a la gran pobreza en que ha vivido; pero gracias a su padre aprendió a cultivar la tierra y agradece el esfuerzo de su padre en enseñarle, porque con eso pudo sacar adelante a su familia.- El lugar donde cultiva lo tiene a un kilómetro de distacia desde su casa, actualmente siembra maíz y frijol, pero también se dedica a la ganadería, tiene vacas lecheras, vende queso, requezón, entre otros lácteos y con eso van cubriendo algunas necesidades del hogar.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 novillos de repasto para engordarlos y venderlos cuando estén grandes y con la ganancia comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos.   

El sueño más grande de José, es mejorar la vivienda porque está deteriorada.
texts.en:
José, 66, is a farmer. He did not finish school. Due to his parents' extreme poverty, he did not continue his studies. He is married, and his wife works in the home. Together they have eight children. They are all adults and are married.



It was not easy for José to give his children a decent life, due to the extreme poverty in which he has lived. Thanks to his father, he learned to work the land, and he appreciates his father's effort to teach him, because that is how he was able to provide for his family. The place where he grows his crops is a kilometer away from his house. He is currently planting corn and beans, but he also raises cattle. He has dairy cows and sells various cheeses and other dairy products, and that covers some of the household needs.



José needs this loan to buy two grazing steers to fatten and sell when they are big enough, and he will use the profits to buy agricultural supplies for planting staple grain crops.



José's biggest dream is to improve his home, because it is deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy two grazing steers to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Micheline prépare du riz en plus des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Micheline s’approvisionne du nécessaire une fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des  sacs de riz, des cartons de spaghettis et des sachets de condiments.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Micheline compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en: Micheline is a married woman, 46 years old, and residing in Tokoin. The mother of two, she makes rice dishes and food products, which she sells in front of her home. She gets her supplies of necessities once a month at the market and would like this loan to put in an order for sacks of rice, boxes of spaghetti, and bags of condiments. With the profits that will result, Micheline is planning on improving her range of offerings and helping her children to thrive and have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of spaghetti, and 4 bags of condiments

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio Sabino se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino continues working in transportation. He is a hardworking person, who through his business is moving his family forward. His dream is to buy a new car.

He seeks a loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Jonathan Josael

texts.es:
Jonathan, de 23 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, pero por diversas razones le fué imposible continuar, está soltero y actualmente vive con sus padres.

Jonathan, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que estaba pequeño, su padre lo llevaba a los cultivos y eso le ayudó a aprender este oficio; más sin embargo, la agricultura no le ha generado los ingresos necesarios, debido a la sequía que atraviesa nuestra región, debido a eso optó por dedicarse a la venta de pan.- Jonathan, se levanta muy temprano para ir a vender a los cantones y caseríos de sus comunidad, lo hace desde hace 4 años y considera que le ha ayudado a generar ingresos para sacar adelante a sus padres.

Jonathan, necesita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para transportarse a las demás comunidades con la venta de pan, porque a pie se le hace muy difícil trasladarse lejos de su casa.

El sueño de Jonathan, es tener una panadería propia para obtener más ganancias y poder ayudar más a sus padres y también ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 23 years old and is a farmer. He went to school through the third year of high school, but due to various reasons it was impossible for him to continue. He is single and currently lives with his parents.

Jonathan has worked in agriculture since he was small. His father would take him to the fields which helped him to learn the trade. Lately, however, agriculture hasn't generated sufficient income, due to the drought that has affected the area. Because of that, he decided to work selling bread.

Jonathan gets up very early to go sell bread in the small rural villages and hamlets of his community. He has done this for 4 years and it has helped him generate income to help his parents succeed.

Jonathan needs the loan to buy a motorcycle to transport him to other communities to sell bread, because by foot it's very difficult to travel far from his home. Jonathan's dream is to have his own bakery in order to increase his earnings and to be able to help his parents more, and also to offer employment opportunities to other people.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport him to other communities to sell bread.

loans.name: Flor De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Flor de esperanza¨ lo integran 6 socios, esperando que con el crédito otorgado mejore su calidad de vida y el de las personas que los rodean. Por primera vez están con ADIM y los socios de KIVA. La líder del grupo es Neydi, quien a sus 30 años lucha el día a día junto con su esposo, quienes tienen dos hijos de edades 4 y 7 añitos. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva  desde hace 10 años. Con el crédito requiere comprar por mayor pantalones, camisetas, shores, ropa íntima para adultos y niños, así lo podrá vender al detalle y tener mejores ganancias. 

Las demás socias son Jessenia, 22 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías en cerámicas y a la venta de yoltamal, desde hace 5 años de manera ambulante. Olga, 28 años, a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años, Velixsa, 33 años a la venta de artesanías en barro; Martha de 42 años a ventas e mochilas de sacos; Justina de 40 años a la comercialización de derivados de cerdo.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Esperanza" group has six members, who hope that this loan will enable them to improve their quality of life and that of those around them. 

This is the first time that they participate with ADIM and KIVA. 

The group's leader is Neydi, aged 30, who works hard, together with her husband, every day. They have two children, aged four and seven. 

She has been earning a living selling new clothing for the past 10 years. She will use the loan to buy garments wholesale such as pants, T-shirts, shorts, and underwear for adults and children so that she can sell retail and earn a better profit.

The other members are Jessenia, aged 22, who has been earning a living as a street vendor selling ceramic handicrafts and yoltamales (Nicaraguan corn tamales) for the past five years; Olga, aged 28, who has been selling clothing for four years; Velixsa, aged 33, who sells clay handicrafts; Martha, aged 42, who sells backpacks; and Justina, aged 40, who sells pork products.

loans.use: to buy garments wholesale such as pants, T-shirts, shorts, and underwear for adults and children.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia  Lucila  se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maíz y papa, ,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura ya que ella es una persona trabajadora y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila continues working in agriculture. She has land on which she grows corn and potatoes. Her dream is to expand her agriculture business, since she is a hardworking person, and through her business to move her family forward.

Lucila seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a single, 49-year-old woman. She's living with her parents in order to help her parents in supporting their daily needs.

She promptly put up a small sari-sari store in the front of her house. Despite the small income, it brought daily income, which is just what the family needed.

Another opportunity presented to her is to borrow a loan to buy more goods, to have a greater income.

Merlyn’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Akpédjé

texts.fr: Akpédjé est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge à Tokoin. Akpédjé est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne et le revend deux fois par mois au marché .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Akpédjé sollicite ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Akpédjé is a married woman who lives with her four children, whom she supports, in Tokoin. She is a retailer of secondhand clothing and stocks up twice a month at the market. To have a considerable inventory and to maximize her profit, so as to respond to the numerous expectations of her customers, Akpédjé is requesting this loan to put in an order for bales of used clothing. The aim is to earn profits for helping out her husband in covering the diverse day-to-day expenses demonstrated.

loans.use: to purchase 8 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Ayawavi Florencia

texts.fr: Ayawavi est âgée de 47 ans et est une veuve femme. Ayawavi vit avec ses deux enfants à Tokoin où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui en trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Ayawavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché du nécessaire et désire commander du maïs et du sucre afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayawavi is 47 years old and a widow. She lives with her two children in Tokoin, where she makes porridge made from corn for her customers, who are satisfied with her business. Ayawavi gets her supplies of necessities once a month at the market and would like to put in an order for some corn and sugar in order to earn a good profit margin, thus to advance her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and a sack of sugar

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Akossiwa  est une femme âgée de 33 ans résidant à Tokoin. Akossiwa est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akossiwa  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates et des sacs de détergents en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en: The married mother of three, Akossiwa is 33 years old and residing in Tokoin. She is a grocer and stocks up on her merchandise twice a month at the market. She sells her merchandise in front of her home. Akossiwa is asking for this loan to put in an order for sacks of rice, boxes of tomatoes, and bags of detergents with the aim of having a considerable inventory and maximizing her profit. She can then help out her husband in providing education to her children and cover the proven day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of rice, 8 boxes of tomatoes, and 10 bags of detergents.

loans.name: Ibodati

texts.ru: Ибодати молодая мама из маленького городка Курган-Тюбе. Ей 24 года. У нее двое детей. Она дома занимается шитьем, а ее муж работает финансовой организации. Ее дочка болеет и ей нужно лечение. Ибодати с мужем много сил и средств потратили на лечение малышки. Теперь еще нужны деньги на продолжения лечения и приобретения медикаментов. Ибодати обратилась за кредитом, чтобы скорее оплатить лечения и чтобы малышка пошла на выздоровления.
texts.en: Ibodati is a young mother from the small city of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 24 years old and has two children.  She works out of her home as a seamstress and her husband works as a financial advisor.  Her daughter is sick and needs treatment.  Ibodati and her husband have already expended a lot of effort and resources toward the treatment of the infant, and now need money to continue treatment and to purchase medicine.  Ibodati is requesting a loan in order to more quickly pay for treatment, and to help her child recover.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and treatment for her daughter

loans.name: Ling's Group

texts.en:
Ling’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ling makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and  she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sovetkan

texts.ru: Советкан, 55 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает медицинской сестрой, также уже 21 год занимается сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 20 овец, 2 лошади, также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,92 Га занимается полеводством, выращивая фасоль, есть фруктовые сады. Деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль около 25,000 сомов (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. В будущем Советкан планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие своей деятельности, постройку сараев и увеличение земельных наделов.
texts.en: Sovetkan is 55 years old and married.  She has a specialized secondary education and works as a nurse.  She has also worked for 21 years in agriculture, and owns 20 sheep, 2 horses, an orchard, and a 1.92 hectare plot of land on which she raises beans.  Her businesses provide her with a monthly income of about 25,000 KGS.  She turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her livestock holdings.  In the future, Sovetkan plans to use the income from the loan to expand her businesses, build a stable, and obtain more land.

loans.use: to purchase cows to increase her livestock holdings

loans.name: Rosa Albertina

texts.es: Rosa de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz se dedica a esta actividada desde hace varios años, comercializa sus prodcutos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Rosa is 63 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter. She works growing corn which she has done for a number of years. She sells her product in the various markets that are close to her house. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. so she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Sulukan

texts.ru: Сулукан, 34 года, замужем, есть 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сулукан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 12 овец на продажу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Сулукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и планирует накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sulukan is 34 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She has a secondary education, and her livestock business serves as her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her hard work, Sulukan owns 2 cows, 2 horses, and 12 sheep for sale.  Her monthly income is approximately 15,000 KGS.  With the goal of further expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep to fatten and resell.  Sulukan plans to use income from the loan to continue to invest in her business and also to save toward house repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de gas propano desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por ser un producto muy vendible, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas ya que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house with her mother. She has been selling propane gas for a number of years. She has many customers because it is a very saleable product.

She is applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of more products in order to be able to continue with her sales, since they generate good earnings for her.

loans.use: to buy more propane gas wholesale

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria de 49 años es una comerciante que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el manejo de Tiendas de víveres y Miscelánea, ella inició su negocio en el barrio donde reside en el municipio de Soacha, con la premisa de generar ingresos para su familia y cuidar a sus hijos.  Ella es madre soltera de cinco hijos; dos mujeres y tres varones de los cuales dos son aún menores de edad y dependen económicamente de ella.  Sus vecinos todos los días acceden a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. a realizar sus compras de víveres como carnes, verduras, aceite, arroz, legumbres, productos para el aseo, bebidas y demás.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en canastas de gaseosas, lácteos y bultos de arroz. Con esta inversión sus clientes encontraran todos los productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar en un solo lugar, además de ser de fácil rotación en su stock, lo que permite dinamizar la reinversión del capital.  Su meta a futuro es comprar un lote de terreno fuera del municipio y adquirir un carro.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old. She is a merchant who has extensive experience in managing food and sundry stores. She launched her business in the neighborhood where she lives in Soacha municipality, on the premise of generating income for her family and caring for her children. She is a single mother of five children, two female and three male, of which two are still minors and economically dependent on her. Her neighbors shop daily beginning at 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. to make purchases of food such as meats, vegetables, oil, rice, beans, cleaning products, drinks, and more.

Currently, she is applying to her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], in order to invest in crates of soft drinks, milk, and sacks of rice. With this investment, her customers will find all the products that are part a family's needs in a single place. Besides implementing easily in her stock rotation, it enables her to boost her capital reinvestment. Her goal for the future is to purchase a plot of land outside the municipality and to acquire a car.

loans.use: to invest in crates of soft drinks, milk and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 53 years old, married, and has eight children to provide for. She owns and manages her rice farm to earn a living. Merlyn has been engaged in his business for ten years. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays. So, she decided to borrow a loan  to purchase fertilizer for her farm so that she will be able to produce a good quality of rice to satisfy the needs of her customers and so that she will be able to deliver more rice in the market, that will generate more income. 

Merlyn's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rafael De Jesus

texts.es:
Rafael, de 37 años de edad, está casado y junto a su esposa han procreado dos hijos, su primera hija tiene 18 años de edad y está estudiado bachillerato, su segunda hija tiene 14 años de edad y estudia noveno grado, cada día trabajan duro para poder cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijas.
