Su negocio es la bisutería, ella elabora manillas, anillos, cadenas, collares y accesorios en general para venderlos por menor en su puesto de venta fijo, “vendo mi propia producción, los clientes me hacen pedidos en colores y diseños…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que recibe pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de bisutería. Su sueño es ser la mejor vendedora, ella desea realizar la compra de material de bisutería para realizar nuevos modelos para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yaderi solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de bisutería para realizar nuevos modelos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaderi is a 27 year old woman. She lives with her husband and has 2 children, ages 3 and 5. Her business is in jewelry. She is a good mother, patient, and very entrepreneurial. She has her business in the central "mutual" area, where there is a lot of business movement.

Yaderi has dark skin, a short stature, and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish as well (first to the right, in a white shirt). She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and with her children who are not yet school age. They live in a rented room, built of brick and cement, with a tin roof and all of the basic services.

The need to cover her children's expenses brought her to form a bank of people with business such as: selling food, key workshop, leather crafts, hat making, second-hand clothing sales, selling drinks and selling fruit. Her business is in jewelry. She makes bracelets, rings, chains, necklaces and general accessories to sell as retail in her shop. "I sell my own production. The customers give me orders in colors and designs," she says.

The advantage of her businesses is that she receives orders. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy jewelry material. Her dream is to be the best seller. She wants to buy jewelry materials to create new models for her business.

This is the first loan through the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this work. For those reasons, Yaderi wants to ask for a loan to buy jewelry materials to create new models for her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials to create new models for her business.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de venta de pescado frito. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una congeladora para conservar el pescado fresco. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio mejoró, cuenta con variedades de pescado perfectamente congelados listos para su cocción, “la heladera que necesitaba ya la tengo, funciona bien y puedo almacenar todos los alimentos sin que se malogren…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias constantes, la desventaja es la falta de muebles para servir la comida, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio. su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea comprar muebles de comedor para atender a los clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida.
texts.en:
Maria continues with her business selling fried fish. The loan that she received was used to buy a freezer to conserve the fresh fish. Her repayments were punctual.

Now, her business has improved and she has varieties of fish perfectly frozen and ready for her to cook. "The freezer that I needed, I now have. It works well and I can store all of the foods without them spoiling," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has constant daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of furniture to serve the food on. She wants to broaden her business through buying tables and chairs for her business. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to buy dining room furniture to serve her customers.

This is the 2nd loan with the institution in 2 years of doing this job independently. For those reasons, Maria is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs to sell food.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell food.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar de 38 años se  dedica a la agricultura y compra-venta  de granos básicos. En la comunidad de Olanchito,Honduras donde vive Cesar con su esposa Sandra y sus seis hijos, no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, es por esta razón que Cesar adquirió hace unos años  un sistema solar con el cual la calidad de vida de él y de su familia mejoro muchísimo. Al pasar de los años dos componentes del sistema solar se dañaron, por lo cual el sistema ha estado desactivado y han tenido que alumbrarse durante ese tiempo con lámparas a base de kerosén y velas y caminar largas distancias para tener cargado el teléfono celular. Pero Cesar necesita reactivar el sistema solar para evitar todos esos inconvenientes y que sus hijos puedan hacer sus tareas y estudiar tranquilamente ya que uno de los objetivos que Cesar tiene es que sus hijos puedan tener la mejor educación posible. Por esta razón es necesario solicitar financiamiento a SOLUZ Honduras para  adquirir los componentes (batería e inversor) que el sistema solar necesita y que pueda volver a funcionar y brindarles a Cesar y su familia nuevamente una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 38 years old. He works in agriculture and in the buying/selling of basic grains. In the community of Olanchito, Honduras, where Cesar lives with his wife, Sandra, and his six children, there is no access to electricity. For this reason, Cesar obtained a solar power system a few years ago and the quality of life for him and his family improved a lot.

As time has passed, two components of the system have been damaged, so the system has been deactivated. They have had to get light from kerosene lamps and candles during this time, and have had to walk long distances to get charge on their cellphones. But Cesar needs to reactive the system to avoid all of these inconveniences and so his children can do their homework and study peacefully. One of Cesar's goals is that his children can have the best education possible.

For this reason, it is necessary for him to ask for funding through Soluz Honduras to get the components (battery and inverter) that the solar power system needs. This way it can start to work again and give Cesar and his family a better quality of life once again.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable pack (battery and inverter) which will help him to reactivate his home's solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks and cold meats.

loans.name: Sharlyn

texts.es:
Sharlyn   vive con su compañero en la zona de Esparza, no tiene hijos;  mujer joven con más de 3 años de trabajo en su negocio de venta de perfumes y  accesorios de mujer, fue integrante del grupo de Fundación Mujer Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Progresando de Barranca, donde recibe la capacitación y se forma dentro de esta metodología. Se tuvo una buena gestión del préstamo, pero al trasladarse a otra zona, se les dificulta seguir con el grupo, por lo que ella opta por el crédito individual. Maneja una mercadería actual que consigue en  viajes a la frontera y en algunas tiendas en San Ramón, que revende a sus clientas.

La empresa cuenta con un patrimonio, que ha sido producto de sus ventas y trabajos ocasionales que ha desempeñado. El préstamo solicitado es para realizar las compras de esta temporada. Cuenta con una cartera de clientes consolidada, que ha mantenido en este período.  Su recuperación es a 30 días, cobro quincenal en cuentas grandes, lo que le permite tener ingresos para cubrir la cuota del préstamo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa y bisutería con lo que paga sus estudios y apoya a su hogar con ingresos económicos. Vende a familiares y amigas, desplazándose donde sus clientas, tanto para mostrar la mercadería como para el cobro, vende durante todo el año, comprando mercadería de temporada, cuenta con  experiencia en el comercio, compromiso de trabajo, demuestra cualidades buenas para la organización de su trabajo.  El crédito les va  a permitir tener un capital adicional para poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a sus clientes dándoles una mayor variedad de productos a buenos precios.
texts.en:
Sharlyn lives with her partner in the Esparza area. She has no children. She is a young woman with more than 3 years of work experience in the business of selling perfumes and women's accessories. She was a member of the Fundación Mujer ['Women’s Foundation'] Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Progresando de Barranca ['Progressive Women of Barranca Women’s Solidarity'] group, where she received training and developed within the methodology. She had good loan management, but after moving to another area, it was difficult to continue with the group, so she opts for a loan for an individual. She manages current merchandise that she procures while traveling to the border and in some shops in San Ramón, which she resells to her customers.

The business’ history has been in her product sales and the odd jobs she has worked. The loan she requests is for this season's purchasing. She has an established customer base, which she has kept during this period. Her recovery is within 30 days, she collects fortnightly on large accounts, allowing her to have income to cover the loan installment.

She makes a living selling clothes and imitation jewelry, which pays for school and supports her household with income. She sells to family and friends. By moving to where her customers are, both to demonstrate the merchandise as well as to collect it, she sells throughout the whole year. She purchases seasonal merchandise, utilizing her commercial experience and commitment to the work. She demonstrates good organizational qualities in her work. The loan is going to allow her to have additional capital to be able to offer better conditions to her customers, giving her a better variety of products at good prices.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hen makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Them's Group

texts.en:
Them’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Them makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Sophia is in her late 40s and is married with four kids who are still at school. She has been selling broiler chicken for ten years now. She works from 8am to 12pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sophia’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of chickens and she repaid the loans successfully. She used the profit to pay for school fees and the loan repayment, and to cover household expenses.

She is happy about this loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She will use this loan to increase her broiler chicks and buy chicken feed. She dreams of having more broiler chickens.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group, Ununio, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her broiler chicks and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Cansado de solo producir para sobrevivir, de tener pérdidas por el clima, de no avanzar, de ver pasar los años y seguir siempre con lo mismo el señor José quiere dar un cambio drástico a su vida, dejar el miedo e invertir en su negocio, sabe que tiene todas las capacidades para sacar adelante a su familia, a sus 4 hijos que tan solo tienen 8, 7 4 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, quiere que estudien y cambie su realidad.
Por tal razón, con mucha decisión desea solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales para ampliar su galpón, compra de pollos y compra de cerdos para introducirse en este campo de cría de ganado porcino.
texts.en:
José, tired of producing enough just to survive, and of the losses he has suffered owing to the climate, of not getting ahead, of the years passing and the situation remaining the same, wants to stop being afraid and make a drastic change in his life. He wants to invest in a business, and knows that he has all the qualities he needs to be able to help his family get ahead and ensure that his four children, aged 8, 7, 4 and 3, will be able to study and change their futures.

For this reason, he wants to start a pig-rearing business, and is requesting a loan buy materials for expanding his shed, and to purchase chickens, pigs and feed for fattening them.

loans.use: to buy materials to extend his barn, and to purchase chickens, pigs and feed.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Banana farming is something that is more of a passion for Beatrice than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2012. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Kangutu, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of four lovely children. For the past three years she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling banana, milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Beatrice passionately loves banana farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan which she paid back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. Beatrice is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy more banana seeds so that she can plant more banana trees. The banana seeds she plans to buy is not just an ordinary banana seed, but of quality. Bananas cost more money and with this loan she will get a lot of profits and also satisfy the demand that is in her village for bananas. From this loan, the life of Beatrice will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Beatrice waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy banana seeds

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 36 лет, замужем, 2 детей школьников. Образование у Чынары средне-специальное, она работает поваром в Войсковой части. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 14,900 сом (KGS). Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на проведение ремонтных работ, за счет покупки дверей, красок, обоев и прочего. Свои доходы Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Chynara is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two school-age children.  She has a specialized secondary education and works as a cook for the military.  She makes a monthly income of approximately 14,900 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to perform home repairs.  She will use her money to buy doors, paints, wall-papers and other materials.  She is planning to use her earnings to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy doors, wallpapers, paints and other construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El socio Ernesto se dedica al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza casas y edificios, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de maestro de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernesto works in the construction business, making homes and buildings. His dream is to expand his construction business. He is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy construction materials such as wood and tools.

He is very happy to receive the loan, and pledges to meet all his repayments.

loans.use: to by construction materials such as wood and tools.

loans.name: Efrain Antonio

texts.es:
Efraín es un hombre trabajador, honesto, honrado que con sus manos y su perseverancia ha sacado adelante su familia, la cual la conforman su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y que se dedica a las labores del hogar y sus 4 hijos de 11, 6, 4 y 10 años de edad, vive por ellos, entrega cuerpo y alma en su trabajo de cría de aves (pizcos), para generar su alimentación y tenerlos estudiando.
Este hombre a pesar de tener una gran responsabilidad de mantener a su familia no renuncia a su sueño de ser un profesional y aunque sabe que primero están sus hijos, quiere a toda costa estudiar y superarse personalmente.
Efraín necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos para su labor, principalmente necesita comprar maíz en grandes cantidades y realizar mejoras locativas para proteger a estos plumíferos que son tan débiles al frio, comprara zinc, un material de lata para colocar un techo.
texts.en:
Efraín is hard-working and honest, honored to be able to support his family with his labor and his perseverance. He lives with his partner, who takes care of their home, and their four children, aged 11, 6, 4 and 10. He lives for his family, and throws himself body and soul into his turkey-rearing business in order to provide food for his family and ensure they have an education.

Although he has a lot of responsibility towards his family, he wants to become a professional, and, even though his children will always come first, he also wants to be able to study and improve himself personally.

Efraín needs some economic support to buy supplies for his business, especially to buy large quantities of corn, and to make a zinc (tin) roof to ensure that his birds, which are susceptible to the cold, are sufficiently protected.

loans.use: to buy corn and materials for fixing the roof on his sheds.

loans.name: Guido Manuel

texts.es:
Guido es un joven de 25 años de edad, con esperanza e ilusión de cambiar su futuro y el de su familia. La falta de oportunidades de empleo dio lugar a que este responsable y audaz muchacho se convirtiera en independiente ejerciendo una profesión que fue inculcada desde la niñez por su hermano la cual es la cría de aves.
A pesar que hace poco inicio con su negocio ha podido generar los ingresos suficientes para llevar el alimento diario a su mesa.

Su propósito es mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo, ser competitivo y buscar un mejor futuro para su familia.
Aunque su negocio marcha bien, le falta capital para hacerlo crecer, para tener mayor número de animales y poder dar competir con los precios que actualmente hay en el mercado.
Guido necesita un apoyo económico para dinamizar su actividad, dicho apoyo lo quiere invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento de engorde, con el préstamo lograra comprar aproximadamente 100 ejemplares.
texts.en:
Guido, aged 25, is hopeful and happy at the idea he can change his future and that of his family. The lack of job opportunities has meant that this responsible and brave young man has become an independent business-owner raising chickens, a trade that he learned from his brother in childhood.

Although he only started his business a short time ago, he has been able to make enough to provide food each day.

He wants to improve his sales, increase the number of customers, cement his business, be competitive and seek a better future for his family.

Although his business is doing well, he needs capital to make it grow, by buying more animals so that he can offer competitive prices in the current market.

Guido needs economic support to boost his business by investing in chickens and feed for fattening them. He will use the loan to buy approximately 100 chickens.

loans.use: to buy approximately 100 chickens and feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Una apuesta muy grande por el futuro es la que se encuentra realizando el empresario Diego, un hombre de 34 años de edad con grandes sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pero este empresario vende buena cantidad de animales, debido al movimiento de sus ventas quiere ampliarse y dar abasto a todos sus clientes y ahora mucho más que se encuentra próxima la temporada de diciembre la cual es la que genera mayor utilidad  ganancias por su buen movimiento de ventas.


Pensando en el futuro de su familia, de su negocio, Diego quiere realizar una gran inversión y crecer en un 200% aproximadamente, con el monto solicitado comprara; materiales para la ampliación de sus chiqueros, comprara cerdos de cría y lechones.
texts.en:
Betting big for the future is where the entrepreneur Diego finds himself currently. He is 34 years old with big dreams and aspirations for his life. He raises pigs, and this entrepreneur sells a large number of animals. Thanks to his substantial sales, he wants to expand his business and provide good service to his customers, particularly given that December, his best period for sales, is approaching.

Thinking of the future for his family and his business, Diego wants to make a big investment and expand his business by approximately 200%. With the loan that he has requested, he will buy materials for enlarging his pig pens, and buy piglets and pigs for breeding.

loans.use: to buy materials to enlarge his pig pens, and purchase piglets and pigs for breeding. He wishes to expand his business and capture a larger share of the market.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma’s husband owns a metal shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, in which he sells iron sheets and rods. The iron rods he sells are used for constructing concrete roofing and manufacturing iron accessories. He has been in this business from his childhood. That is why he has no qualifications, but he wants to educate and feed his family. He wants to generate maximum income so he can easily reduce the financial constraints upon his family.

For the sake of his family's future, he wants to increase the inventory of his shop on a daily basis. In this way he can easily generate maximum income to support his family. Due to lack of capital, Salma is compelled to take out a loan.

Salma is aged 51, a mother of five children who she has to look after. She wants to give financial support to her husband, so he can easily make his holy aims come true.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron goods for her husband's metal shop so he can increase inventory on a daily basis.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a kind and polite woman. She is 31 years old, married and a mother of two children. Dilafruz lives with her family in the city of Tursunzade. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.

Dilafruz sews pillows and mattresses to use for traditional weddings. She started this activity six years ago. She has achieved great success in quite a short period of time, due to her hard work.

Now Dilafruz would like to expand her activity and improve her family's living conditions. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to purchase lots of fabrics and all the necessary accessories for her work, and significantly expand her business. In the future she wants to use the benefits of her activity to renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase lots of fabrics

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, sugar, coffee and soap. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, sugar, coffee and soap.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell such as bread, juice, junk food and personal care products.

Annalou has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 34-year-old single woman with one child living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has a retail shop, the business she started with a hope of employing herself and obtaining income for her family. Little did she know that this business would keep her moving on; she has become so hardworking that in the future she hopes to build a good house for her family and educate her child to higher levels of learning, as a caring parent. Mary has asked for a loan to help her buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: El Amir Joud Group

texts.en:
Samira is the featured borrower for El Amir Joud Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and earn a living at the same time.

Samira is a 52-year-old married mother of five children. Four years ago, she opened her grocery shop to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother. Today, she is acquiring a loan from KIva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her merchandise to include vegetable oil and some accessories to satisfy her customers' needs. Samira is the first lady on the left.  With respect to the other group members, Khadija is the lady standing in the middle, and Manal is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to expand her merchandise to include vegetable oil and some accessories to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en: Thai’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thai makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en: Savuth’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Savuth makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: A $1,500 loan is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day, because she lives near many people. She will buy some additional supplies with this loan including sugar, salt, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, shampoo, milk, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities since 2008, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable running her business because she has been helping her husband to be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, shampoo, milk, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Chhea's Group

texts.en: Chhea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kiryantama United Group

texts.en: Margret is a member of Kiryantama United Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan from Hofokam. This is an old group that is taking a loan for the 24th cycle. Most group members deal in agriculture and are grateful for the support given to them that has enabled them to change their diet,educate their children and repay their loan installments as expected. Just like other farmers, Margret is faced with a challenge of seasonal changes which reduces her harvests. Margret has asked for a loan to  buy seeds of tomatoes and carrots for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds of tomatoes and carrots for growing

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en: Yun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: Albertina built her house a few years ago with her own working capital. Now she has plan to renovate the house but she does not have enough money to buy more materials for the job. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital. Then with her husband, she will use this loan to buy materials such as sand, cement, iron, nails, wood and glass. Albertina is happy because Tuba Rai Metin can help her to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Oun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. She has one youngest child in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 53 years old and works very hard to provide for her daily needs. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell like canned goods, spices, junk food and home care products.

Annette has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Iron Women - N13T09Qđại Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 30 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making iron furniture for 8 years. Nga lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase inputs for manufacturing metal and machines,...
In 2014, Nga joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution

Nga is the group leader of N13T09QĐại, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Nga hopes for her children to go to school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a good business.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for manufacturing metals and machines

loans.name: Tepatasi

texts.en: Tepatasi is 28 years old with 1 child. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tepatasi requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Seidy Rita

texts.es: Seidy tiene un pequeño vivero en el cual se dedica a la siembra de diversas plantas, con las cuales posteriormente realiza arreglos florales.Ella solicita un préstamo de ciento cincuenta mil colones (₡ 150 000), para la compra de semilla y plástico para proteger sus plantas.
texts.en: Siedy has a small nursery in which she grows a variety of plants. With these plants, she then makes floral arrangements. She requests a loan of one hundred fifty thousand colones (₡ 150 000) for the purchase of seeds and plastic to protect her plants.

loans.use: to buy plastic and seeds.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a 35 year old mother with 6 children, she runs a business of selling tuna sandwich, toast sandwich in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Luisa requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter,.

loans.name: Shirlet

texts.en:
Shirlet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Shirlet successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Shirlet's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestocks and sell.

She supplements this income with earnings from her selling vegetables.

Elvira dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more livestock and sell.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
DUTERIMBERE is a group led by Marie Rose, who is 32 years old. The group name means “Vision” in English. Marie Rose is married and has 3 children aged between 3 and 8 years.

She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 4 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas, sugar and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sugar and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 50; she is the mother of three children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She sews the shoulder bags along with her husband and a daughter at home to meet the household expenses. She has two sewing machines for sewing hand bags, which are operated by her daughter. Her husband deals outside’s customers, takes orders from them and sews the bags on order.

She wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags but does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy the sewing machine and additional raw material such as rexine, zippers, buckles, etc for sewing bags.
Her desire to sell her sewed bags directly in to the market, so that she can get maximum reward against mutual efforts. She thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and additional raw material such as rexine, zippers and buckles for sewing bags along with her family members.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 26-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes, a business she started with the hope of creating employment herself. As her stall is not under cover, her sales are affected by unpredictable weather changes, such as too much sunshine and rain. In spite of this, she has future plans to buy land and build a house, plus move her business to a more permanent under-cover location. Harriet has requested a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
En el año 2008 la vida del señor Jesús tuvo un cambio drástico, este hombre tomo el riesgo de dejar su empleo y tomar su propio camino como independiente y fue quizás la mejor decisión ya que la independencia económica que logro y el aumento de calidad de vida de sus seres queridos fueron algunos de los resultados que ha logrado en estos 7 años de labor ofertando sus servicios de Jardinería.
A pesar de que tiene que laborar todos los días y en una intensidad horaria mayor a una jornada laboral, se siente orgulloso y feliz ya que su familia sonríe y puede disfrutar de un buen alimento, de estudio gracias a este trabajador hombre.
Jesús es padre de dos hijos su meta es que estudien y se conviertan en todos unos profesionales, sueña con el día en que se estén graduando y el llorando orgulloso de sus muchachos.
Entrando en materia el empresario quiere realizar una inversión para actualizar su equipo de jardinería que ya está obsoleta y ha presentado fallas, por ello quiere solicitar un aptó económico para la compra de una guadañadora para podar césped y herramienta de jardinería tales como escoba, tijeras, entre otros.
texts.en:
In 2008, the life of Jesús took a drastic turn. This man risked leaving his employment to follow his own independent path and it was perhaps the best decision he has made because of the economic independence that he obtained and the improvement in the quality of life of his loved ones. These were some of the results that Jesús obtained from the 7 years of work offering his services as a gardener.

Despite his need to work everyday, and at a high intensity daily schedule, he is proud and happy now that his family smiles and they can enjoy good food and schooling thanks to this hardworking man. Jesús is the father of two children. His goal is that they will study and all become professionals. He dreams of the day that they will be graduating and he will cry with pride for his children.

Moving on, this businessman wants to complete an investment to upgrade his gardening equipment because it is obsolete and failing. Because of this, he wants to seek a loan to purchase a scythe for mowing and gardening tools such as a broom and shears, among others.

loans.use: to update his gardening equipment, he will buy a scythe and tools such as shears and brooms, among others.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
Ihsan is a 26-years-old married woman from Gaza city, located in the Gaza strip. She lives with her family in a small house. Her husband works in the public sector where he earned low income. Because it’s difficult to find a job in Gaza , she wants to open her own business, which is a mobile phone store, as she has experience from her previous job about selling mobiles and accessories for mobiles, and she has an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Ihsan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell. This will make her independent.
Ihsan appears in the photo in her new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married man aged 32 and living with his wife and children.
He is involved in cattle rearing/fattening from his home area. According to him; he has been in the above activity all his life.

Fred is involved in cattle trade which also majorly contributing to his sources of income. Through the above projects, Fred has been able to buy land plus also taking care of his family and sisters. Fred has also acquired this facility to boost his cattle fattening business.
Fred says his customers are basically people from his home area and trader’s.
According to him, his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.
He is described as a hard working man and he appreciates the work done by Ugafode. He now wishes to expand the size of his herd for greater profit.

loans.use: to boost his cattle trade business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 58 years old and separated with one child, who she works very hard to provide for. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as beverages, eggs, canned goods, junk food, sugar and home care products.

Belinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to expand her store to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kyee Hnint Pin 1 Village Group

texts.en:
Than, from Kyee Hnint Pin Village, is 30 years old and married. Because of the current huge flooding in Myanmar, famers from this area like Than are struggling to secure their farms. Even though, the village has had little disruptions, farmers will have to replant the crops again.

This loan from Proximity Designs will help Than's family purchase feed for ducks in order to have nutritious eggs. They have raised over 100 ducks and Than has years of experiences at this business. He hopes to have regular cash flows that covers whole family's living cost.

Above are the members from Kyee Hnint Pin Village Group 1, named Kyaw, Than, Tin, Tin T and Nwe. The loan will help a total of 17 group members and generally, they plan to expand their ducks and feed. To use well planned and balanced foods are very crucial, so duck raisers work very hard for their ducks.

This village is located in Kyee Hnint Pin Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River, Delta Region. Besides duck farming, for business, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural products. But almost every household raises animals as livestock or business.

loans.use: to expand ducks numbers for more eggs and purchase feed for them.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 24 años y se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos desde hace 7 años; vive en una comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras junto a su esposa y dos hijos. La esposa de Jorge debe levantarse muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y para que Jorge pueda irse a trabajar en la agricultura, sin embargo esta labor se le dificulta un poco, ya que al no tener acceso a energía eléctrica debe iluminarse con velas y esto es perjudicial para la salud. Por esta razón Jorge solicita  un  préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar que beneficiaria la vida de su familia ya que no tendría que caminar largas distancias para mantener cargado su celular y además ya no estarían expuestos a los humos tóxicos que las velas producen. Jorge espera con este sistema mejorar en estos aspectos y que su esposa pueda hacer las labores de la mejor manera posible sin dañar su salud.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and has worked farming basic grains for 7 years. He lives in the Olanchito, Honduras community with his wife and two children. Jorge’s wife wakes up very early to prepare food and so that Jorge can go to work in the fields. However, this work is a bit difficult since having no access to electricity, she must use candles that are harmful to her health. 
Therefore, Jorge is requesting a loan through Soluz Honduras to acquire a solar system that will benefit his family’s life. He will not have to walk long distances to charge his cell phone and they will not be exposed to the toxic fumes produced by the candles. Jorge hopes this system will improve these aspects and allow his wife to do her work in the best way possible without damaging her health.

loans.use: to buy a solar system that will improve the conditions and quality of life of his home by eliminating pollution caused by candles and kerosene.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Hermelinda works hard to support her family. She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Hermelinda is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more clothing stock such as shirts and pants.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Hermelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es: Elvin quien vive en Olanchito, Yoro se dedica junto a su familia al cultivo de granos básicos como frijol y maíz y también es productor de café desde hace 8 años. Estas labores exigen que Elvin se levante muy temprano cuando aún es oscuro para salir a trabajar, a la compañera de hogar de Elvin se le dificulta tener que preparar los alimentos para él, ya que no cuenta con energía eléctrica en la cocina de la vivienda, además Elvin no puede trabajar por las noches expulpando café ya que al no tener buena iluminación no puede realizar esta labor que sería de mucho beneficio para él, ya que avanzaría más en sus labores. Por esta razon Elvin está solicitando préstamo a Soluz Honduras  para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayude a él y su compañera de hogar a tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que con esto no solo tendrán un ahorro en sus finanzas sino que su salud mejorara mucho y podrán tener acceso a cargar sus celulares siempre.
texts.en:
Elvin lives in Olanchito, Yoro and he works, together with his family, on the cultivation of basic grains such as beans and rice. He has also produced coffee for 8 years. These labors require that Elvin gets up very early when it is still dark to leave to work. Elvin's wife finds it very difficult to have the food prepared for him because they do not have electricity in the kitchen in their home.

Moreover, Elvin cannot work at night removing the pulp from his coffee because he does not have good lighting. He cannot complete this work that would be very beneficial for him because it would advance him more in his work processes. This is the reason why Elvin is seeking a loan from Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar panel that will help him and his wife have a better quality of life because with it they will not only improve their finances, it will improve their health a lot and they will be able to always have access to charge their phones.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel which will help him save money from buying candles and kerosene, and improve the living conditions of his home.

loans.name: Lib's Group

texts.en:
Lib’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lib does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In Lib's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shim's Group

texts.en:
Shim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Shim works as a seller to support her family.

In Shim's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
Soung’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Soung makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In Soung's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokphat's Group

texts.en:
Sokphat’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokphat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In Sokphat’s village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es emprendedor, dedicado y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ área comercial manufacturera e importadora de todo tipo de mercadería. 
Guido es moreno de baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él se encarga de comprar metales y fabricar, puertas, ventanas, portones, escaleras, y otros, “mi padre me enseñó el oficio cuando trabajaba en su taller, hace 4 años me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con trabajo constante, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de planchas de metal. Su sueño es abrir un taller de cerrajería grande, él desea realizar la compra de planchas de metal para fabricar portones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Guido solicita un préstamo para la compra de planchas de metal para fabricar portones.
texts.en:
Guido is a 27-year-old man, single, with no children, and his business is metalworking.

He is enterprising, dedicated and very hard-working. His business is located in the Max Paredes zone, an area of commercial manufacturing and importation of all sorts of merchandise.

Guido is dark haired, short and has a robust physique. His native language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his family members who work, live in their own house build of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor, which has all the basic services. His business is metalworking. He takes care of purchasing metal and making doors, windows, gates, stairs and more. "My father taught me the trade when I worked in his shop, 4 years ago I became independent..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he has constant work. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase metal plates to make gates. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 14 years that he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Guido asks for a loan to purchase metal plates to make gates.

loans.use: to purchase metal plates to make gates.

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonesa works hard to support her family. She has a "buy and sell" mineral water business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from "buy and sell" rice.

Leonesa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water for her "buy and sell" mineral water business.

Leonesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en:
Khern’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khern does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In Khern’s village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario nació en el municipio de San Ramón, es casado y padre de un hijo de 5 años de edad, el señor Mario estudio en la escuela de esa comunidad, pero solo llegó a estudiar hasta cuarto grado, luego decidió trabajar en agricultura a sembrar granos básicos. Poco a poco fue ahorrando dinero y compró una propiedad la cual trabajaba en su propio terreno sembrando granos básicos, plátano, cacao para luego venderlos.Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo ahorrar un dinero el cual lo ocupo para poner una venta pequeña y comprar uno o dos terneros que luego los vende. En la comunidad donde vive el señor Mario no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación, este sistema solar será de gran beneficio para los miembros del hogar ya que su niño está empezando a estudiar y podría realizar también sus tareas  por las noches, además será de gran beneficio ya que puede alumbrarse por las noches para atender a los clientes que lleguen a comprar a la venta, podrá cargar la batería de su celular para estar siempre comunicado con sus clientes y familiares y hacer muchas cosas más, Mario estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para poder comprar el sistema solar.
texts.en: Mr. Mario was born in the municipality of San Ramon. He is married and the father of a 5 year old. He studied in a school in his community only up to fourth grade. He then decided to work in agriculture to grow basic grains. Little by little he saved money and bought a property to work as his own growing basic grains, bananas, cacao to sell. With a lot of effort and dedication he was able to save money which he invested in a small business to sell one or two calves for resale. There is no electricity in his community thus he is asking for  a loan to buy a solar system which will be installed in his house. This will benefit his family members because his child is beginning to study and he could do his homework at night. Besides, it would help illuminate the house at night to help clients who come to buy product. He will be able to charge his cell phone to be able to always communicate with his clients and relatives and do much more. Mario is grateful for the opportunity offered to buy this solar system.

loans.use: buy a solar system of 100 watts with 5 installed lamps.
